description:
My faith in TC is renewed. Lovely people. Great food. Comfortable space. 

(Would prefer all seats -- vs some -- be cushioned. Ouch!)
author: Richard F.

description: Delicious quick meals with super friendly staff. I had an interview today and asked the waitress for a quick meal and was surprised how quick, delicious, and wonderful the experience was. The waitress was super friendly and the pad thai was PHENOMENAL. Would definitely recommend!
author: Alexis P.

description: great warm welcoming service. delicious flavorful food. & a clean sterile bathroom! You can tell the people who work here care about their customers and their food! I would love to come back here, wish they were closer to home so I could eat here more often. 5/5 beautiful experience
author: Tay B.

description: I stop here for first time for food nd the food was really delicious....bt something tragic happen with me here I was done eating nd old Asian person gave me my bill..I was paying my bill nd i got the call from work so I started talking on my phn...when I was leaving this again guy called me very rudely nd said that..why u didn't gave me tip nd I said sory  what happen..he started saying me same thing then he said don't come back bcoz u didn't gave  me the tip...I really got disappointed...never gonna go back to this place..
author: Heera R.

description:
Hello Mr. Chef,

So I came across you as I was going to check out that large market across the street (Mollie Stone). As I walked by I thought - hey another potential lunch spot! I've pretty much eaten up and down Castro Street and been wishing to eat somewhere new.

Lunch Special? Sweet! I went ahead and ordered a BBQ Pork, Chicken Green Curry combo. Took that bad boy back to my office nearby.

Unfortunately, I thought the BBQ pork was just ok. The green curry though was just so watery. Lacking flavor and again just very watery. Perhaps it was a bad day? Perhaps it is because it's a lunch special? I always feel terrible for giving a low rating but it is what it is.

I will one of these days give you another try and perhaps just order something from the menu. Then I'll update this accordingly.

Hoping that that other items are better!

until next time I go wandering for lunch...
author: Paul L.

description: Never had a bad meal here.  Tonight with old friends.  Lovely chicken satay, corn cake appetizer.  Great service.  Food was light and fresh.
author: Sfclint O.

description: I love this place it's great! The food is awesome n always bring friends who are visiting to this place. The Thai food is really good n the staff is great ! I totally record this place !
author: Charlie M.

description: WARNING!!! Do not come here if you're vegetarian. The wait staff has no concept of what that means. We ordered vegetarian papaya salad and there was fish sauce in it. I mentioned this to the waitress and she said you should have mentioned no fish sauce. I told her that's not my job.. if it's advertised as vegetarian on the menu it needs to be vegetarian. THEN THE VEGGIE PAD THAI CAME OUT AND IT HAD FISH SAUCE IN IT AS WELL!! And this is after we mentioned vegetarian means no fish sauce. I have not eaten meat in over seven months.. now I feel sick to my stomach and completely crippled.. Again do not come here if you are vegetarian. They have no respect nor basic professionalism for people like us. Go to Thai House Express instead.. please!
author: Jimmy C.

description:
They have a really good menu with a very various plates. Waiters are so kind, excellent service. 
At the time waiters bring you the food it's the greatest thing in the moment.
author: Fesar M.

description:
I've been here a few years back, but now i'm ready to write my review after this visit lol. I recently had dinner here with my buddy and we both enjoyed it. I loved my Pad Kee Mao dish. I wish i had remembered to order it super spicy, but I still loved it mild. The great part about my dinner was that it was moist/wet. I often find that some places make very dry noodles and that kills all the flavor. 

The server was very friendly. I'm guessing that she must be an owner of the place. Not sure though. She was very attentive and filled our drinks as needed. We also had several beers which she didn't fail to ask if we needed another one. 

The docor is simple and clean. Restroom is clean too. I'm definitely coming back when I'm in the Castro again.
author: Andrew S.

description: This restaurant is an excellent value for the money, the choices are large, and the quality of the food is good. I had the lunch special barbecued chicken and veggies. The service is good.
author: Kenneth K.

description: It's been many years since I ate at Thai Chef.  I went there yesterday with my husband and two friends.  I'm glad  I did!   I had the Crispy Chicken, a delicious fried chicken dish.   My husband had the lunch special which gives you a choice of two items from their appetizer and entree selections.  He chose the BBQ chicken and vegetables.  I tasted his choices and thought they were very good.  The service was excellent and the prices are quite reasonable.  Check them out, especially for their lunch special.
author: David G.

description: please forgive the lateness of my review. Few weeks ago I ordered the seafood curry ..when it came to my table, I was given the dish in a live coconut shell. This was the best Thai dish I have ever had... I can recommend this place 1000x and always be satisfied.
author: Karmelita P.

description:
I went on a weekday at around 7:30 pm to order a carry-out. Their service was really nice, friendly and fast. 

Great for vegetarians; they have a whole section for veggie items. 

I tried their Vegetarian pad see ew and I liked it a lot.  They ask you how spicy and I requested Medium. It was perfect. It looked like they don't use much oil which is what I liked. Their vegetables were grilled a little bit instead of 100% sauteed in oil. 

I recommend it!
author: Hiral P.

description: I used to like this place... after a couple of visits, the service continues to be terrible. I didn't want to argue with the waitress but their version of food shows with their lack of customer service
author: Jasmine S.

description:
I love getting their Tom Kha Gai there. Probably my favorite out of all the places I've been too. Perfect amount of sour, and I love the mushrooms that they use!

Their crispy chicken fried rice is a little too oily, but I can't stop eating it. 

It's a bit pricey for The food there, but to me still better than the other two in the Castro.
author: Myk S.

description:
Do you remember that Sally Struthers infomercial back in the nineties for the International Correspondence School? She would tell you that you could earn your degree without setting foot into a classroom to start your highly lucrative career in VCR Repair, PacMan Design, Handgun Repair, and the list went on and on and on. I must have missed the one for Osha Thai Wannabe Restaurant Management. Not that I think Osha Thai is all that, but there are sure a lot of darkly lit Thai spots that have the same vibe and serve basically the same plates of food with little distinction (photo: http://bit.ly/ON9XA2). That's how I barely remember Thai Chef on 18th near Castro, surely inspired by Sally's sound advice.

First things first, the staff is very friendly. They're very helpful in pointing out the 116 items (...yes, 116) on their menu not including beverages (photo: http://bit.ly/Naz3aO). The $6.95 Thai Chef Spring Rolls were first, they always are (photo: ). Jamie W. had been here before, so he knew to get the flat noodles, the Thai chow fun if you will. He ordered the $9.95 Pad See Eiw with Chicken that included bamboo shoots, carrots, cabbage, onions and a mystery gravy (photo: http://bit.ly/1huBe3A). I went on a similar path and got the same priced Pad Thai with Pork and the usual suspects - tofu, egg, bean sprouts and green onion (photo: http://bit.ly/1crlPMQ). It was OK and just OK, nothing special and rather by-the numbers, although I won't go as far to say the cook went to correspondence school. But maybe...

FOOD - 3 stars...middling Thai dishes have flavor but lack distinction
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...presumably inspired by Osha Thai, all of them
SERVICE - 4 stars...friendly and attentive
TOTAL - 3 stars...Sally has a diploma she wants to send you
author: Ed U.

description: Love this place, came here to eat dinner with my family. I honestly think the service here makes the experience so much better. Would recommend!! The fried chicken and rice is so delicious.
author: Tifffany G.

description: After getting exhausted at Folsom Street Fair, we decided to go to the Castro to get something to eat. This was on a list of suggested places to eat, so we went here and was impressed by the politeness of the servers and the quick service of food. Everything was so tasty and brought out in a timely manner. I would also mention, at the time of going, it was hardly packed. There was only 2 other tables being occupied. Seems like a fun place to go if you're tired of the usual style places you go to when you want this kind of food.
author: Jason C.

description: This was some of the best Thai food I have ever had.  Of course, you should know that I am from Vermont and do not get a lot of Thai food.   However, it was a delight.  I have no idea what I ordered and could not pronounce it if I tried.  That said, staff was friendly, the place was very clean and comfortable.
author: Christine H.

description: Walked by many times never dined here. Glad we did. Greeted very warmly by the hostess (owner?) From start to finish everyone was pleasant and accommodating. Had the green papaya salad as an app and it was terrific. Asked for medium spice and it was for sure. Wife had the tofu Panang Curry and loved every morsel. There was a sweetness to it which was appreciated after the fiery salad. I had the roasted Duck which was in a fabulous sweet and sour sauce. Only problem was that I had to spend a lot of time cutting away the fat. The meat was delicious and reminded me of the sauce used on Chinese spare ribs. Skipped the wine and opted for lemon ginger tea which was perfect for the meal.
author: Joe M.

description: The service was very terrible the waiter took about 15 minutes before he came to my table to offer me a drink. He didn't service other people who came in right after me first and didn't even bother to ask me what would I like is the recommendation. When the food arrive it was very warm along with the fact that it wasn't what I expected. When I went to get my check, I felt like I was getting ripped off because of the amount that I paid for for the limited quality of food that I purchase. I will never visit this place ever again along with the fact that the weather did not receive a tip for me. Whoever is in charge of the restaurant, really needs to reevaluate their staff and make sure that they are taking good care of their customers because should not have taken more than 15 should've taken less than 15 minutes to greet your customer and offer them a glass of water. I will be telling my friends not to come to this establishment ever again as I will not be returning and that is why they got the star in the review that they received.
author: L W.

description: Very good lunch !!! Welcoming staff !!! And good price for the food !!! I will be back for sure.. hidden gem in the castro area..
author: Marnie P.

description:
What luck! My elderly mother & I were headed to the Roxie to watch Casablanca on Christmas and we wanted to grab a bite first.
We knew the Mission would be slim pickings (witness a dozen folks huddled outside a nondescript Chinese joint on Valencia), so we figured we'd get more action in the Castro.
Yep we did. This place was open and the staff was SO nice and after we got there around 5:30 it started filling up with festive diners and families.
We only required "adequate," not "fantastic," so you can imagine our pleasant surprise when the food turned out to be WONDERFUL.
We had tom kha gai, pad see ew, green curry with brown rice and a delightful hot jasmine tea. Under $40 for a big feast. 
So good that even though we planned to save some for leftovers, we couldn't stop eating! They are quite skilled at veggies and every bit of broccoli & carrot was crispy and flavorful. The soup especially was bright and tasty with lots of tangy lime.
Even if it's not a holiday and there are other restaurants to choose from, I'd totally rush back here for another amazing meal. Yum!!
author: Lisa T.

description:
I hesitantly ordered delivery here because my go-to thai delivery in the neighborhood (Rin's) was closed. 

Tom Yum soup -3 stars. Flavorful, but pricey for what you get.
Pad Thai - 0 stars. This is the worst pad thai I've ever tasted. No flavor, barely any meat, bland noodles. It was terrible.
Pad Si Ew - 0 stars. This is the most bland thai dish I've ever tasted. It's supposed to come with broccoli, and there were only a few chopped up pieces of bitter stalk that did not taste fresh. Barely any egg or chicken. A total rip off that tasted like boiled stale water. Also, there was a piece of burnt saran wrap or something in there I gagged on. 

I could not have been more disappointed with this meal. I'd have been better off squeezing sriracha sauce all over the money I paid for it with and eating the bills. I will NEVER order from here again. I have no idea how they are still in business.
author: Jordan Q.

description:
Consistency! And very good food, and it's well priced, too!
The calamari salad is a must have, and there's so much choice, and it's all good!
Service and kitchen quick and on point.
Can get busy, so worth the effort!
Enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
Went there with some friends and eveyone seemed to like the food.

The service was ok and the food was solid. Not the best Thai i have ever had but indeed very good.

The Som Thum was delicious and so was the red curry. It was very fresh and tasty. OK prices too.
author: Carolina M.

description: My friend adores Tom Yam seafood and knows it's authentic taste. So he claims that this is the closest pick of how it should be. Thai restaurant menu varies and has lots of stuff, as well as specials. Thai beer is also provided and deserts. Anyway, it's a great choice for a lunch break with light easy food.
author: Julia S.

description: One of  my favorite Thai restaurant's in the city.  The best Pad See uw is found here.  But everything really is good.  And the service is great.  Great go-to after Happy Hour :D
author: Juan M.

description:
I tried this place for the first time for lunch recently and I felt like this was just another Thai place, nothing special, although a step above the Thai places in the area.

Pros: fairly large establishment so you don't feel so "cramped", food to go comes out in less than 10 mins.

Cons: food seems overpriced especially for lunch (but hey it is the Castro). The quality of the food is rather bland, lacks flavor.
author: Mel L.

description: THE BEST thai food in the city. Great waters, and good dining experience. I have been eating here for more than a decade now. It never disappoints!!!
author: Martin N.

description:
Fabulous food at a super reasonable price. The pineapple cashew chicken was fabulous- huge prawns in there too! The plate was huge; I was able to take half with me and share with a guy on the streets. 
Don't be afraid of the neighborhood. The Castro district has history, beauty, and some awesome people hanging around.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I've been going to Thai Chef for several years, and I'm quite happy with it.  Overall I've had excellent, friendly service, and I've never had a bad dish.  There have been a few small bumps when the place is very full and there's a new waitperson, but overall, they've been minor.  To the reviewer who claims that the food isn't authentic Thai--I don't have a clue about that.  I've never been to Thailand.  Thai Chef's food is authentically good to my taste buds, it's consistently good and fresh, and it's served quickly.

Full disclosure:  there was a time a while back when I noticed that their DPH score was low, and I avoided it for a few months.  They've done a lot of work, and they've brought it up to a very satisfactory 96.

I've had a lot of their dishes, and those that I seem to go back to often are the tom yum soup, the beef salad (mercy, it's good), the red curry, and the pra ram (the curry and the pra ram usually with chicken).  I tend to stay away from the duck dishes, as I do at many Thai and Chinese places, because there's never enough duck for my taste, and what there is tends to be too fatty for me.  

It's fast, it's pleasant, the waitstaff is lovely, the food is great (try the beef salad), and the prices are reasonable.
author: Earline A.

description:
The perfect place to take a quick rest from the pace of the Castro.  Very nice location for a romantic dinner with you loved one, too.

Quiet a selection to choose from.  We especially enjoyed the spring rolls and Singha beer.  :-)

The service was quick and unobtrusive.
author: Terry F.

description: Best crispy chicken fried rice I ever had and their prices are great. It's definitely my favorite place for Thai food in a great area: Castro
author: Eliana C.

description:
With a blatant disregard for a serious allergy the Server, Manager, and Kitchen Staff failed three times at this business. I have a serious allergy to carrots and after clearly discussing this with my server - she smiled and repeated it back to me so I know it wasn't a language breakdown. It was delivered not by my server with carrots all over it - something that seems easy enough to fix. 

When I objected the food carrier hadn't a clue - my server didn't communicate my allergy properly to any staff members for when I asked for it without carrots he almost gave me a hard time. I insisted he find her and get the info. Then after a few minutes the dish is brought back without one apology by the original female server - I take one bite and realize there are still carrots in the food - they simply took off the carrots and reserved the same dish. My server eventually realized this was an error and offered me a free beer, really like that even matters if I'm swollen on my way to the ER!

At this point I had them cancel the dish - I simply couldn't trust them to prepare it carrot free. No manager came to apologize or comp any part of the meal - a free beer was all that was offered. I demanded at this point, politely, that my dish be removed from the bill, which was met with...I will have to pay for that from the original server...really, you're the victim here, right. What?? WOW! 

This blatant disregard for a serious allergy is unacceptable and if I could I would report them to the Board of Health so they may be penalized for such vulgar negligence. I seriously will never be back and warn as many people as I can!
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Food was ok, served promptly and hot.  Not the best Thai I've ever had - but good.
author: Jim W.

description:
Is it gravity or attraction that keeps me coming back here?

It is more likely a combination of great food at a descent value, great service, and pure convenience (especially for take-out).  Through one way or another, since living in the 94114 zip-code, this place has quite grown on me as an easy option for when my boyfriend and I aren't feeling like wandering too far, since Thai Chef is right around the corner from us.

-My favorite appetizer prawn rolls, is very nostalgic of my mum's cooking and some of the finger foods I was exposed to early on as a child.  A tightly wound cellophane noodle, minus the veggie mixture that is perhaps the most minimal item on the menu. Perhaps some pickled daikon, or a cucumber side salad would be a nice complement?!

-Duck was perfectly crisp, and complemented simply with flash fried Chinese broccoli and a sweet & sour sauce
-I also enjoy the duck served in red curry, which has some subdued heat to it.  Usually duck curries I've had elsewhere are highly fatty, but it's nice that they clean up the impurities so there isn't too much suspended grease.

-Pumpkin curry with seafood has become one of my favorite staples, it is savory, delicious, and artfully presented in a hollowed out squash.  It really looks like someone had fun conceptualizing this dish, but most importantly the execution always has been consistent every time i've ordered it.

-Yellow curry, of the non-greasy variety, with moist /succulent chicken and potatoes..  Hearty, warm, and usually a loft sized portion that carries over until the next day for lunch-time leftovers at work.

-Mango prawn fried rice was the perfect blend of savory and sweet, the perfect amount for sharing, and a great alternative to plain Jasmine or brown rice (depending on varying degrees of hunger).

The only negative comment I have about Thai chef is the table for 2 at the front window, it is VERY awkward! Unless one enjoys being gawked at in consistent intervals while in the midst of dinner conversation.. Some frosted glass, bamboo blinds,semi-sheer silk curtains.. anything would be nice to obscure the disrupting gaze of the gays walking by.
author: Ty T.

description:
This was my second visit here and the first was much better for food quality and value. 
The fried chicken rice was not served hot and we ordered two diet cokes and only one can was used for both. We ordered one refill for one of us and they charged us for three drinks. Thad basically one can of diet coke got $6. I recommend leaving the can or serving less ice in each glass so you get more soda. I hope it improves because I like this place.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
We used to like this place until now. We ordered for delivery and the guy on the phone said 45 mins even though we are just up the hill from their location. An hour and 10mins later after we called them twice asking where our order is. The delivery guy finally arrived. We told him he was late and said that it is unacceptable, instead of apologizing for his tardiness, he said " we are busy and if you are not happy you should not order with us anymore!" He was very rude. Instead of him getting a $5 tip we gave him $2 instead. Even though he did not deserve any. 

Over the time the service at this restaurant had gotten bad, it's sad because we don't have much Thai restaurants around here in the Castro area. 

You are RIP to us Thai Chef...
author: Jay I.

description: Hidden delicious little gem. A friend put me onto this place. The staff are so friendly and care, and the food is to die for. I'm personally addicted to the soft shell crab curry, and their soups are a-ma-zing.
author: David B.

description: By far one of my favorite Thai restaurants. Even when I travel I use Thai chef as the bar to compare other Thai foods. My favorites: Beef Salad with its smokey grilled flavor; Duck Basil has the perfect sweet and sour combination. More sweet than sour; Duck curry (I think it's panang) is heavenly too.   And oh yes the crispy whole fish is nom nom nom.
author: Ed F.

description: It's not the greatest Thai food I've ever had but the service is fast and friendly and the food is decent and reasonably priced. It's a nice ambiance and you can get in and out and on with your evening in less than an hour, while still being able to have a dinner out with friends. Three people enjoyed the coconut rice, glass noodle salad, fried crab, duck curry and Thai iced tea/coffee for $62, including 20% tip. Good value for the area and it wasn't overly crowded at 8 pm on a Sunday night.
author: Jill D.

description: Great lunch special we got the spring rolls with red curry and salad soup with pad Thai it was perfect to share as 2 people on a date and the inside was atmospheric and quaint ! Service was ok and the lemon water was great touch
author: Sophia W.

description:
I've been here a handful of times over the years with a friend or two.  No complaints there.  Unfortunately, my most recent experience left a bad taste in my mouth and I won't be back, especially since there are other similar choices in the neighborhood.  

Four friends and I came here for dinner, expecting to eat family style.  The waiter wasn't exactly helpful with entree choices and gauging whether or not we had ordered enough food.  No sooner was the food put on the table then he asked how everything was.  Considering we hadn't even finished putting food on our plates, we couldn't answer.  We passed the food around and enjoyed most of our meal.  The dishes were tasty, although the portions were on the small side.  

Towards the end of dinner, the conversation turned to the meal itself and we realized that the fried duck dish had barely any meat in it it.  (We were too busy during dinner to talk about it and each one of us figured that we were the only ones who hadn't tasted it.)  There was literally one small piece of meat at the bottom of the plate of fried batter.  Only one person actually received any duck and the rest of us had eaten fried bits of air.  I quietly pulled the waiter aside to explain the situation and ask that that dish be comped or discounted.  Instead of working with me on the issue, he blamed us for not knowing how much meat would be in the dish.  The situation escalated because he was extremely defensive.  He walked away, spoke with another waiter at the front, then decided that the best course of action was to ignore us for a while without coming back and at the very least, bringing the bill. 

A friend then took the matter to the front register.  The waiter was very rude, told him that we should have ordered five dishes of the duck if we each wanted to taste the duck meat.  It was ridiculous.  He made the situation much worse by blaming us for trying to order family style.  The other waiters argued with him as well.  It was in poor form.  Apparently, there wasn't a manager on duty to smooth over the small issue that could have easily and quickly been resolved. Instead, their poor customer service lead to loosing five customers who will not be back.  That can't be good for business.
author: Judith D.

description:
DISCRIMINATION ALERT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
 I walked in this place after playing at a club in the area and the owner took one look at me and shook his head! The place was nearly empty on a Friday night (which was a red flag), and I was in disbelief that an owner would be so rude to a potential customer! At first I didn't understand what he meant, but then in broken English he said that he would not serve me! It was obviously because of my long dreadlocks, because I was dressed very nice from my gig, and was clean and presentable. It was shocking to me because he is located in San Francisco,  in the middle of an area that has a history of winning the fight against discrimination.
 After I scrolled down the yelp list and read the latest review, I considered myself lucky not to give the jerk any of my money! Stay far far away from this rude meanie. I included another review of someone who actually ate this bigots food. Very bad karma awaits this horrible creature.
This is the review by my fellow Yelper who had the unfortunate experience of eating there:
Two words: rip off. I ordered the Tom Yum Soup. It cost me $12, plus I gave $3 on a TO-GO order (too generous). When I got the soup, it was HALF WAY full. I asked if this was the large order (I ordered the large), and they said yes. I asked if they could ask the kitchen to fill it up because it's awfully expensive for how much they give. I was given a total attitude by one of the employees and an eye roll by another. One actually said, "well what do you want me to do; you keep complaining." I handed it to him and asked that he have them fill it up. The kitchen did, but I could tell there was animosity about it. Never again will I ever return. Learn some customer service skills and be more generous with your portions, Thai Chef, and maybe you will be a more successful restaurant.

I will add that it was 6:30 pm and the ENTIRE PLACE WAS EMPTY. I know why. Bad ju-ju.
author: David B.

description:
We just dropt in to this Eureka Valley establishment.

It's a pleasant room, the service is very friendly without being intrusive, and the food is average for the Castro neighborhood, i.e., pretty good. The value is fair, too.

It's not worth going out of your way to visit, but it's certainly a good choice when convenient.
author: Icono C.

description: The quality has slipped a little bit here. This used to be our go to place for Thai in the Castro, but the last time we dined in, the Thom Kha soup was cold and not as flavorful as it was in the past. They also used to serve the pumpkin curry in a kabocha squash, which was very charming. That was not the case during our last visit. Service was attentive though and we will not give up on it just yet.
author: Audra S.

description:
I can't believe I've never tried this place prior to now. A friend and I wanted to try someplace new in the neighborhood.  We started off with the Tom Yum Soup. It had great flavor and we finished every drop.  We also ordered the Basil Fried Rice, Duck Basil and a rice noodle dish that my friend says was Pad Woon Sen.  This was the only miss here due to the rice noodles were overcooked and soggy/watery.  I deducted a star for that. 

Service was friendly.
author: Bill L.

description: My partner and I went to Thai Chef last night and ordered the pineapple curry prawns, fresh spring rolls, and papaya salad.  All were very good but the pineapple curry was a standout in being both subtly sweet and subtly spicy.  The tasty combination of pineapple and curry here is really something to be tried.  Delicious!
author: Mark O.

description: After our dining plans changed due to a nearby restaurant being closed, we strolled around the neighborhood to find Thai Chef.  I give this place 3 stars as the food was mediocre. The Tom Kah soup was bland, and the shrimp was tough. One plus, the veggies were fresh.  The shrimp rolls were very good and so were the corn cakes.  We also tried the yellow curry with chicken, which was just okay. Nice clean place, but not worthy of more than 3 stars.  I was visiting from San  Diego, and would assume that SF would have even better Thai. I'll keep looking.
author: Del P.

description:
I'll go ahead and take part in the blame. I didn't know what crispy noodles were. I'd never had it before. And typically, when I crave Thai food, it's because I want some green curry or pad thai; but I wanted to venture out and try something new. So, I opted for the crispy noodles.

But I didn't know crispy noodles were served with a slimy sauce (or what they call "special sauce" or "gravy"). That's not normal, is it? It can't be. What a combination: some of the noodles were crispy and the rest were soggy and swimming in some slimy sauce. 

I tried to pick out the crispy noodles that had yet to mingle with the sauce. It became a game, but just ended with me being sad and hungry. So I decided to try a bite of the spring roll (stuffed with silver noodles, cabbage, carrot, Chinese sausage, and shrimp), which was just OK, but can someone tell me what's in Chinese sausage? On second thought, I'm not sure I want to know. 

Unless anyone's willing to enlighten me on good menu items, I'll just stick to my pad thai.
author: Adena B.

description:
After a tiring golf game, we were hungry.

We came at like 330ish in the afternoon, after driving back from Redwood City.

So hungry we didnt even bother looking at the Menu and asked for PadThai.

Service was efficient, no..Excellent!

I have no more battery life on my phone and I asked if I can have it charged without any charger with me and the Cashier obliged.

I was gulping water like I just came from the Sahara desert and never did I asked the Server for a refill. He just keeps refilling it even before the glass is out...it felt like it was bottomless.

The PadThai was delicious, service excellent, what more can you ask for?

When you're in this neck of the woods, go check them out. It will not disappoint.
author: Malou C.

description:
Food was good. Service was meh.

I just didnt like the fact that they kept giving the wrong food to the wrong person and since my friends were unfamiliar on what their order looks like, they started eating what was served only to find out that it was not theirs.

It also took a while before someone asked for our orders and i had to keep on reminding them that i needed water.

And to top it all off they include the gratuity on your final bill then have a space for gratuity on the credit card receipt. If you didnt check the final receipt you'd think that gratuity is not yet included. Tricky tricky!
author: J.e.e. M.

description:
Two reasons to go with them: 1) They are super friendly; and 2) they deliver!

My husband has availed his bachelor spirit to their delivery services a few times in the past and I took the plunge with him last night after a fit of laziness overcame my desire to walk even 2 blocks. They told us the delivery time would be roughly 45 minutes but our food came in 20. Despite it sounding loud and busy in the background, they nailed the order and the food definitely exceeded any preconceptions I'd formed from the storefront & website appearance (they just need some fresher signage and a website tweak ;).  

My Sweet Basil chicken was quite tasty and his staple white curry chicken also certainly did the trick. We weren't thrilled by the spring rolls (the 'Chinese sausage' was a bit mysterious) but the overall benefit of delivery, super friendly and prompt service + 'ample' fare officially makes this a local standby for our lazy personas.
author: Diane B.

description:
Another 'just ok' Thai food restaurant in the castro.  Had the three meat panang curry which was good, but all the meats were deep fried in thick breading and it was topped with fried basil.  They should have called it the 'Three fried curry" haha or fast food curry.

I did enjoy that they had a few different options for rice (ginger, garlic, brown, coconut, etc).  Appetizers were standard, but were really over priced.

Im going to stick with my favorite Thai in the castro  Thai House Express.
author: Alan H.

description: Ambiance is nice. Our waiter was fantastic ! When I was there he was the only one ... So at a busier time - he may stretched too thin but perhaps they have more staff later. The food was meh. I had the Penang curry - was very mild and quite watery - all the other thai curries I've had before had a thicker consistency which I prefer . Overall an OK choice I paid $13 including tip (didn't get an  appetizer/dessert/drink).
author: Dawit M.

description:
I must confess, I've never actually been to Thai Chef.  I only ever get delivery. 
You can count on Thai Chef to make some pretty solid Thai Food.

My favorites are:
Spring Rolls
Soft-Shell Crab Fried Rice
Pad Thai
Duck Curry

I've had a couple of misses over the years: 
Prawns Papaya Salad- just meh.  Maybe it's better fresh at the restaurant
Sunrise- a lot of unidentifiable ground meat

Once you find out what you like on the menu, you can count on it to be consistently good.
author: M R.

description:
I am furious after an absolutely inexcusable experience dining here.  
My dining companion very carefully ordered his meal and explained to the waitress that he was extremely allergic to carrots (like; deathly allergic) and she acknowledged the information.  When his meal arrived it was garnished with carrots.  He was suitably horrified and called the person over who had delivered the food to send it back.  When the server came over to verify the problem there was no recall of the mention of the allergy, but she said she'd tell the kitchen.  Several minutes later, his meal arrived again (the experienced waiter in me thought it was WAY too fast) sans carrot garnish.  And as my friend tucked into his meal, he fished out a carrot on the second bite!  They had simply removed the garnish and sent it back out, completely ignoring his need for NO carrots, as if the carrots weren't infusing into the sauce....  
And to top if off, we had to argue with them to remove it from the bill (they didn't even offer any form of redress).
In my opinion, this blatant disregard for the safety and health of their patrons is completely unacceptable and if I could give them zero stars I would.  
As a former server with 18 years of experience, I am appalled at the cavalier attitude and lack of responsibility from the entire staff; kitchen, server and management.  
I will NEVER AGAIN eat here.
author: James G.

description: It's ok. Reasonably priced, but not the tastiest. You can definitely find better Thai nearby, but you could probably do worse.
author: Brian L.

description:
I just ordered cashew chicken to go....When I got home and opened the box,  no cashew was found.
I had this dish many times in the past year,  and there were less and less  cashew each time. Guess they finally decided to leave out cashew all together.
author: LW C.

description:
It was hard to review this place because I had such a mixed experience of it in so many ways.

It's been my regular go-to place in the Castro for Thai food... not because it's worth the trip there just to eat... but simply because I love Thai food and I love the Castro... so there's that. Also, this place has a lot going for it. The servers are friendly (and one or two are very cute), the location is spectacular, they have a nice though small selection of wines, and the people-watching from the windows is very entertaining. Prices are average-to-high, but that's to be expected.

They just lose a star with me for the same reason why they probably gain a star with most other reviewers. Authenticity. I know, it's the Castro. I know they can't get away with being 100% on point. I know that the majority of the patrons aren't seeking real Bangkok style Thai cuisine. But I am, dammit... and the food, while fine, lacks that realness that you can get elsewhere. It's Americanized and it's lacking something. Not that it's bad. It's just not a homerun, and since everything else is good that's forgiveable but when I'm craving the real deal, this isn't where I'd go.

That being said, last night two cute Latino boys walked by wearing nothing but sneakers, turned at us in the window, smiled, and gyrated their hips so their junk flopped back and forth. You can't really get that anywhere other than the Castro: Priceless.
author: Sean B.

description:
Good points:
*Relaxed atmosphere with prompt service...it's nice to find a sit down eatery in the Castro that's not packed to the brim. 
*Fresh and perfectly cooked veggies in our curry dishes - the colors were so vibrant too.
*Cute presentations of our iced coffee and iced tea - served in tall glasses with crushed ice and origami rosettes created from the straw wrapped (see pic attached).

Dissapointments:
*Green curry not spicy enough! My nose didn't run at all, and I didn't have the need to chug down my iced coffee at any point during the meal.
*No chili sauce at the tables. I didn't bother to ask for any, but I'm sure it can be provided upon request. It's the first time I've eaten Thai without having all the condiments available. 
*Slight over-pricing with the menu...$4 extra for seafood, which we had in the curry. There were scallops, mussels, and calamari bits which were fresh, but not plentiful. The ratio was higher with the veggie ingredients. Also, $2 extra for a cup serving of rice (jasmine or brown rice), and no free or discounted drink refills.

Overall, I enjoyed our dinner, but this won't be my first choice the next time I have a craving for Thai food.
author: Elaine W.

description: The service is good and the ambience is excellent hence the 2 stars. The food is not bad but it is definitely not Thai and if the chef is trying to be adventurous he needs to reign it in. I had a pineapple fried rice - when you order something like that you ate expecting a certain taste profile  instead what you get is fried rice with curry spices... it was just wrong and tasted really bad... the fish cakes were nice but had very stringy uncut cilantro in it.. like the was too lazy to chop it up.. overall.. the meal was edible but a thorough disappointment and the prices unjustified. Even the green curry was disappointing. .. didn't taste Thai at all.
author: Anand D.

description:
Place is awfully pretty at night, with the dimmed-down mood lighting and little wall nooks for reclining buddhas and tall candles everywhere. Gets crowded on the weekends since it's right next to Badlands and across from Toad Hall.

Pad see ew is decent here, though portion sizes could be a tad bit bigger (noodles are cheap, ya?). Great with the vinegar from the pickled peppers, though definitely check that it's not fish sauce it's soaking in sometimes (that was quite an unhappy salty dinner when I ladled it on and then tasted...)
author: Kevin L.

description:
"DECENT"
(2.75-3 stars)

Restaurant picked by default. I thought pad thai has a thai peanut sauce taste??? Something is fishy up in this mix!!! OVERKILL. Felt like this place was an extension of King of Thai. meh, not a good thing in my book.

- food, had better - but its aiight
- prices, fair
- service, great - no complaint
- ambiance, small

On our way to twinpeaks to have an "i hate my xbf and why did he do this to me bash" homegirl heart-to-heart talks, we stopped thru the castro to surf thru crowds of sexie gay men (I'm a faghag) on the street to have some thai food. Initially the other thai restaurant near by closed and we had to reroute ourself to this restaurant. Restaurant picked by default. However, do appreciate them accommodating us at a later hour and not rushing us out the door after they were already closed and put up all the chairs on the table. 

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

PAD THAI (tofu) - The serving size was decent, "family style", and enough to share with a few people. Maybe because we girls and we eat like birds. The dish looked appetizing but after the first bite, i can taste the overkill of fish sauce. It nearly took over the taste of the thai peanut sauce. Flavorful to some but a little salty to me. I was only able to take a small portion to eat. Here's my suggestion, keep the fish sauce dense.

CHICKEN PAD MA KUA - Again, serving size was decent, "family style", and enough to shave with a few people. Maybe because we girls and we eat like birds. Liked this dish more than the pad thai. Wish the chicken pieces were smaller, they were kind of big or maybe my mouth is just small.

SIDE SERVING - brown rice. I do know my rice pretty well and the brown rice looked like normal brown rice. Not Thai jasmine brown rice. Whatever, rice is rice.

Will I be back? not a first pick and would rather try something new.

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description: Sugary, spicy, and satisfying. The meat was not the highest quality or the most tender....
author: Morris R.

description:
Love the ambiance. 
Love the service.
Love the duck curry.
Love the Tom Kha soup. 
Love the location!

Best Thai food ever!
author: Amanda H.

description: AMAZINGGGGG!!! The pumpkin curry is SO bomb! It comes in a real pumpkin - too awesome! The ambiance is very intimate & the service was exceptional. A must go for THE best Thai food!
author: Fahren F.

description:
The Beef salad appetizer is a winner. Everything I've tried here is solid too... Thai iced tea, yellow curry, pad see yew, pumpkin curry. Service is friendly. I've got no complaints. Nothing fancy, but if you're looking for take out or something casual and affordable to eat, this is a good option in the Castro.

On a side note, I like the dinner ambience as well. It's warm and cozy. Definitely not romantic, but cozy.
author: Aleyna S.

description:
First time working at home and I decide to explore the neighborhood for lunch.  I happen upon Thai Chef and am jonesing for a small Tom Kha and Fried Rice.  I'm happy to find both on the menu, but can't justify $20 for lunch so I side with the Tom Kha and find out it comes only in "large" for take-out.  To my dismay it comes out in a pint container and is 3/4 full.  I complain that a quart downtown costs $6 whereas they are charging me $10 for a small pint.  They say that is how they do it in the Castro.  C'mon we don't rip each other off in the Castro!

I'll give them credit on the food.  The Tom Kha was pretty good, though they went a tad too much on the tamarind.

This is the last time I go to Thai Chef.  I hope everyone out there has a better experience than I did.
author: Gene Y.

description:
I used to go to this place quite regularly with my girlfriend who rents a room in the Castro area.  They used to be one of our primary go to places as their prices and portion sizes were reasonable, however the last time I came here on 6/29/12 to order soup the portion size was 1/2 of what it used to be but at the same price $9-$10!!  That's RIDICULOUS!!!

I can pay the same price at Zadin just down the street across Castro and get a larger and better tasting soup so Thai Chef we go NO MORE!!  Maybe Thai Chef will figure out they made a collosal mistake and fix it or go out of business, but until they reset their prices and/or increase their portion size to what it used to be I will NOT be returning.

I truly wonder if this is how businesses in the Castro begin their downfall and shut down, by gouging their regulars until they have no more regular customers and go out of business?
author: Arthur Z.

description: Kinda barfy... I don't think any of these people have been to Thailand.  Granted, on my one trip there I was spoiled with authentic Thai cuisine, but I've had much better from other Thai restaurants.  The only thing I would recommend is the chicken satay.  Ordered chicken pad thai, which came with a bonus shrimp surprise in it.  Rice is ok, but that's about all I have to say.  Again, I consider this very mediocre at best.
author: B. Thomas A.

description:
This place is delicious! I went with a couple of friends so I was able to try a lot of different dishes. I don't remember them all, but I had Pad See Ew, Duck Curry, Fried Rice, and a couple other chicken dishes. 

I'd say I'm a pretty picky eater when it comes to trying new foods; however, the presentation of the food and the taste was remarkable! You can tell when dishes are rushed and not made properly, but that was not the case here. My favorite was the Pad See Ew of course! And one of the chicken dishes with the thinly diced chicken and some type of peanuts I think? (Sorry I don't remember!) 

The service was also wonderful! The waiter was very kind and attentive during the whole visit. Sometimes places in the city are so busy that getting good service is not an option which often makes the whole dining experience dreadful. Thankfully though, the service was great!

I would highly recommend this place if you are in the area and craving some delicious Thai food!
author: Vanessa P.

description:
1. They didn't give me a menu until I asked for it....a little over 5 minutes after I was seated.

2. I am ready to order and they haven't come by (10 minutes has passed by) to check on me. I finally had to flag the server down.

3. The server and the host are looking at pics on Grindr and totally shooting shit with each other. 

4. Forgets to put my order in. 


I normally would not have waited but I really wanted Thai food. Oh yeah, this place is empty!
author: Hamish K.

description:
August 11 Dinner

Not so great. The corn fritters were overcooked and had thick batter. My usual staple at any Thai restaurant---Gai Kra Prow (sauteed chicken with basil and vegetables) is too sweet and not spicy, even I put in an request for spicy. The highlight of the meal was the spicy prawns topped with red curry paste. But six prawns swimming in the curry are not worth $14 in my book. They also charged $2.50 for a scoop of brown rice. 

Overall there are better Thai places in the city. Maybe it's just the Castro so they can get away with mediocre food. I should have known better when I overheard the huge party next to us ordering nothing but Pad Thai and Pad See Ew with peanut sauce. 

Dinner for two $35
author: Matt Y.

description:
Thai Chef has been my SF go-to-restaurant every time I am in the area - living abroad kills me when I am having a craving! Sydney is not shy of Thai restaurants, but they have nothing on this place. It is in a great area and always hits the spot.

I must admit  that I don't often stray from my personal favourites. Not because I don't want to try the rest of the menu, but I would feel guilty for foregoing the pineapple fried rice, angel wings, or signature Thai iced tea. I have never left unsatisfied!

The portions are good, prices are fair, atmosphere is comfortable and the experience is memorable!

Looking forward to my next trip home. yumm!
author: Alex H.

description:
Gem of the Castro!

Angel Wings
Angel Prawns
Calamari salad
BBQ beef salad
Pad See Eiw (Pork Chow Fun)
Tamarind Fish
Jasmine rice

The cook has redeemed herself/ The previous 2 visits were disappointing & embarrassing.
author: Clifford L.

description:
Definitely best Thai in the Castro - and one of the top Thai places in the city.  It's nothing fancy, but their food is always a hit.  Decent prices, yummy thai food, friendly staff = repeat customer.  


If you are craving Thai food, definitely go there if you are nearby.
author: Juliana K.

description:
Ordered for pickup online. Took an hour to complete order. Ridiculous. 

Food was really bad.
author: Kevin W.

description:
WDUP Thai Chef?

This is some pretty legitimate Thai food and when you find a place like this you just DON'T let it go, ever. The customer service was extraordinary and the food was even better (how? I don't know). I got the pad thai... Felt like the country of Thailand was jumping around in my mouth. This place really is "as good as it gets!"
author: Jimmy H.

description: This is a hidden gem so I'm hesitant to write a review, but after eating here again I am full of appreciation. Very authentic. Great wait staff. Not packed- which is rare and lovely! They have a whole vegetarian menu and I've had the spring rolls, pad kee mow and spinach w peanut sauce and never even had leftovers. Yum!
author: suzi p.

description:
It is hard for me to like Thai food that it's Krung Thai (first thai food that I've ever had).  This place is comparable, even better!

I ordered:
Jan Pad Poo-there aren't many Thai restaurants that offer this dish.  I love it.  Thin noodles, crab, onions, veggies.  Like the Pad Thai but spicier and with crab. My ultimate favorite dish and this place did it justice. 

Pad Thai-Chicken: Thin noodles. Check. Not too soggy. Check. Great consistency. Check.

Papaya Salad-veggy: YUM.

My first time here and I already want to come back for more!
author: Ting B.

description: Great food. Great service. They even lit up the candles when it got darker and made sure my table received exquisite attention. I'll be back!
author: Christopher A.

description: I love this place! Their "Three Taste Panang" is amazing! Seriously, one of the best Thai places in San Francisco!
author: Jeremy C.

description:
A friend who lives in the area did not actually recommend this place.  I'm guessing it's mainly due to poor service rather than the food. We were gastronomically pressed and this is one of the first few restaurants you'll see after getting off the subway, so we went ahead to see for ourselves why there's not a lotta love.

We were greeted by a relatively perky waitstaff and did not have to wait for a table. We got the menus and, for some reason, we were left alone for a long time.  Our drinks were finally ordered after probably reading through the menu 5 times, from cover to cover. 

It's a good thing we were patient enough to wait for our orders because the food was actually good. I've been to several Thai restaurants and Thai Chef's food is not too shabby. I had the deep fried wontons and roasted duck curry stew with rice, which were yummy and I also had a bottle of Singha. We had our fill plus a tinge of buzz that was just enough for the next bar.
author: Rey Q.

description: The way the cooks dole out tofu in the vegetarian pad Thai, you'd think it was an expensive delicacy. Too expensive for what you get!
author: linda g.

description: Ugh, as if people don't stereotype Thai restaurants in gay neighborhoods enough. These portions are tiny, and the smallest I've ever received in my many times frequenting Thai restaurants throughout the Bay Area. I ordered the Pad Thai, and I asked for it spicy. Instead, I received this child size portion of bland noodles with a disproportionate and disappointing amount of bean sprouts. Pad Thai is the one dish you cannot fuck up. Dear management, just because we're gay doesn't mean we starve ourselves. For $10.95, I received roughly half the portion of pad Thai I would receive elsewhere. For $7.95 in Berkeley, you can get awesome hole in the wall pad Thai at Thai Basil which will give you a filling portion of food. I shouldn't have to order two plates of Pad Thai at 165 pounds to have a filling meal. Will not go back.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Wtf kind of dish is crispy vermicelli?  I thought it'd be pan fried, but it was actually FRIED.  Sorry if I don't understand.. but these noodles are what you will find as a garnish on Asian dishes.. nobody makes an entire entree of out of it.  In fact, I just had it a few nights ago at the Cheesecake Factory.. as a garnish/decoration for my avocado eggrolls.  Maybe I'd be less disappointed if there was more tofu and shrimp, but the dish was actually entirely fried vermicelli.  And that's not even the worst part.  The worst part is that I probably got a cavity from it!  The sauce was disgustingly and overly sweet.  It made my Coke taste like water and my teeth were crying. Ugh... Also, it was happy hour.  Drink were buy one get one free but appetizers were only 10% off.  That's about ... a whole 80 cents.

The waiters were nice and I like their folded red napkins.  That's about all they have going for them.  I came here 'cause I really liked the one on Broadway that is now closed and I was so very disappointed.
author: Vivian H.

description:
For the Castro, this place is great.
O.K., its not Isaan food from Thailand, but really, for the Castro it is by far one of the better restaurants in the neighborhood.
We are so close to Valencia St., that top level cuisine won't attract the patrons here. So the market in the Castro is for mediocre food, but Thai Chef really is a lot better than that.
I've eaten here at least 10 times and I am always impressed with the freshness of the food. The fake picket fence on the storefront has gotta go, but otherwise its in the top 5 of the neighborhood.
Staff is friendly and efficient. I always bring my out of town guests here if we want to walk to dinner. Southern Californians always think Thai Chef is great. San Franciscans admittedly are a bit spoiled by the options in the city. The Satay is so yummy and reasonable!
author: Andreas M.

description:
I went to this place tonight after a basketball game around 9. The place was a lil empty since its Wednesday night. The lady in front said we'll sit you guys by the window so people can see people eating. Fine by me.

We ordered garlic pepper seafood and beef. My friend said oh it won't be spicy since she ordered it at other restaurants and they're not which is fine with me since I'm not a spicy kind of eater. My cousin ordered the Pad Sieu(sp). The wait for the food wasn't that bad. Then we tasted the garlic pepper dishes and they were freaking spicy as hell. We asked one of the waiters if it's usually spicy since other restaurants garlic pepper isn't. He said yes they are usually spicy and instead of offering if we would like another dish or ask the chef to get another serving to be not as spicy he just left.I should say the other dishes were good though.

Then came the check. We were only a party of 4 but they charged us included in the total a 18% gratuity! We asked them why we were charged gratuity since it's usually for a party of 5 or more. What they said was it's not on the menu but their boss said they can charge it anytime they want. WTH! And she said to be honest a lot of people don't tip. Um lady how does that pertain to us? Ugh but I can understand why some people don't tip, their service sucks.

Not going back to this place again. Ok food and bad customer service.
author: Mike O.

description:
This place has amazing food and a beautiful ambiance. Great place for a date. However, there are a few glaring problems with this place. 

They close at 10 and every time I've showed up at 9:30/9:45 they refuse to seat me and tell me they're closed. I point out that their sign says they close at 10pm. They still refuse to serve anybody that walks in. Finally after being turned away so many times I asked why they won't take anyone and what their policy is. I came to find out they have an owner who refuses to pay them any overtime they work or pay them after a certain time. This was really sad to hear as the employee was quite upset as he talked about it. 

Also, as of today there is a notice on the front door posted by the health department that they have been shutdown temporarily due to violations. This is not very inviting. But what upset me more is that there is a larger more prominent sign written in marker that they are closed for remodeling. I felt like they were trying to cover up the other notice and basically lying to their customers.  

Won't be back.
author: Leslie P.

description:
The best thai in the Castro period - pumpkin curry comes in real pumpkin!
love the thai iced tea too.
author: Randy S.

description: I was appalled at the way we were treated by the servers.  They were rude, dismissive and cocky.  When one of our friends asked how spicy a dish was..."were told "you need to order because the kitchen is closing"  This was at 9:30pm on a Friday with full restaurant.  Besides being rude and unaccommodating, our non alcoholic beverages were delivered late, waters not refilled.  I run several small service oriented businesses and would never let any team member of mine treat customers in such a manner.
author: I. W.

description: The food was decent. I've has better Thai: I've had worse. My favorite thing was the shrimp rolls. The yellow curry was decent but I felt like I needed to add salt.
author: Greg R.

description: I was unsure what to order and the staff made a good recommendation with the spicy chicken and basil. Lots of flavor, some spices, and a filling meal. Everyone was very friendly and I am looking forward to going back and trying out a few of their other dishes.
author: Andrew H.

description:
OK. when I read at the other reviews I wonder 1. if I was not lucky and it was a bad day for the cook 2. I did not choose the right dishes 3. I may have entered in the 5th dimension and did not go to the same restaurant in our spatio-temporal instant.
Just to summarize, we went there because I heard good things about it. I ordered a thai rice, my partner ordered a green curry. We shared the chicken skewers. Almost everything tasted the same, meaning that it was tasteless, which is quite difficult to do with Thai food.
The portion was enormous, which is OK if you are a student hunting for food for the week but not really if you come to have a pleasant evening with great food.
They are nice and were disappointed when they found out that we barely touched our food. I will not try again unfortunately.

and please, fix this door the cold draft was unbearable.
author: Franck M.

description: Great food in the heart of Castro.  Super attentive and friendly staff.  Good food and good prices
author: Kenyon S.

description:
We had not been to Thai Chef in a couple of years, but my partner wanted Thai food so we took our visiting friend Charles on Wednesday.
My first impression was the decor had been upgraded very nicely.  The host gave us a nice table very quickly.
My partner had a cup of the Tom Ka soup which he liked very much.  For an entree, he had Pad Thai and liked that, too.
I just had the veggie spicy fried rice which was also good but not spicy at all.  I added some chili paste but it still wasn't hot enough so I sprinkled on some chili powder and that did the trick.  The tofu was properly prepared and the veggies were al dente.  I didn't think I could finish it, but I liked it so much that I did finish it.
Our server was a very nice lady who tended to us very well.
It was not the best, authentic Thai food I've ever had, but I would go back for a nice, inexpensive meal.
author: Philip C.

description: Great place to eat. Super quick and the on point for taste. I order the 4 dishes for take out and got it in 15 minutes. The food was yummy and truthfully there were no left overs in sight.
author: Pablo P.

description: Why the low rating!?!? This place is great, yummy, friendly. I don't get why it's got three stars. Everything I've had has been good, a d i've been here several times.
author: Jason B.

description: So far I've been to this place a few times for the convenience of its location. The only thing that's been consistent is the horrible food, OK service and in dire need of a 'thai chef' than can tell the difference between lemon grass and lemon!!!
author: Moe J.

description: Definitely not as good as Thai House. Sorry, Thai Chef.
author: Luke M.

description:
Tried this spot after a film at the Jewish Film Festival @ the Castro Theater. We started with the corn cakes which my wife loved and I thought were a little too "fried." They came with a cucumber relish. We also got the pineapple fried rice with shrimp and it was very good and not too sweet. My wife thought the shrimp were delicious and perfectly cooked. We also got the tamarind fish and that was really good also. A bit on the pricey - the rice was $12.95, the fish $13.95.

The very best thing though was this table of young queens next to us who kept saying stuff like, "I'm not sharing anything with you, biiiitch, I don't want to catch your v.d." Or when someone dropped a plate at least two of them shrieked. They were darling. As was the scenery in general in the Castro.
author: Marco M.

description:
Bathrooms: Clean
Atmosphere: Plain
Service: Inconsistent

This was the first restaurant we ate at in SF. So it holds a special place in our hearts! That being said. We love it! Food is good not great! Our friends meet us here frequently! Service is so so! Food normally comes out of the kitchen hot and timely! We know a few friends who won't go to this place to do a bad food experience. But we have not had that experience so far. So we continue to be regulars.

The Best Green Curry with Chicken Ever!

Rick
author: Rick F.

description: For a Thai place to get 2 stars from me, they have to work real hard to go that low. Simply stating, very unimpressed with their food. This is based on two dishes and one weekday visit. Unlike many others, I found the service adequate. But the food was anything but pleasant. I ordered Pad Kee Mao, which came out within minutes. I would have said the flavor was a bit off if I had found any flavor. Instead I found cauliflower in my dish which only added to the blandness.
author: Rohit N.

description:
The Thai food in this place tastes great to me.  It's a quiet little spot and the prices are fine.  Plus it's such a convenient choice since I live in the 'hood.

What I have an issue with is the service.  Seriously, my last experience at Thai Chef went like this:  

It was close to 10pm and my friends and I were looking for food.  We stood outside the restaurant trying to decide, when the staff members lured us in by telling us "we're still open, come in".  As soon as we were inside, the servers stood over us the entire time waiting for us to finish our food.  On top of that, they turned off most of the lights to signal that the place was closed.

Ridiculous!  That's not the way to treat a local.
author: Angella S.

description: We had dinner there last night.  The food was good and the service was awesome.  The calamari was rather dull and grossly overpriced for such a small portion.  I was impressed by the ambiance in the bustle of the Castro, and was also impressed by the overall cleanliness.  Check them out.
author: Douglas P.

description: I am a fan of the food, it's a little bit different than most other Thai food. Very good. But I am more of a take-out customer, the ambiente of the place itself needs some improvement! It's too old school and dark. Fix the place, and you'll easily get 5 stars!
author: Hendrik G.

description: This place is amazing! The staff is friendly and the food is fantastic. The best thai food I've had till this day. It's a must, go!!
author: Ronnie C.

description: The food was good. The location was convenient. And the staff did a good job and were available. All that said, I don't plan to come here again and wouldn't recommend the place. The restaurant was pretty loud  and the seating was limited meaning you had to sit right next to another party which I didn't care for. The restroom also looked not clean and outdated. Also was not thrilled at seeing the low health score posted by the door as I was leaving.
author: L. A.

description:
I honestly don't understand the positive reviews of this place. This might be what some people want from their Thai food, but not me, not by a longshot.

This was one of the most boring, bland, unexciting, oily, overcooked, thai meals I've had, not only in SF, but ever. (This includes eating Thai food in North Carolina - which was actually pretty good!).

The Pad Thai was incredibly bland, the 'spicy fried rice' wasn't spicy at all and was far too oily. The corncakes were soggy even without the cucumber salad.

I have heard some say this is the best Thai food in the Castro and maybe even SF. I'm not buying - Thai House Express is definitely the best in the Castro hands down.

It wasn't the worst meal I've ever had and I'm sure I'll end up eating the leftovers, but never again.
author: Ennis O.

description: Have eaten here for years and definitely enjoy all the offerings. Service and food is great. I usually get the crispy chicken fried rice, pad thai, tom ka soup, or green curry fried rice. All are money money moneyyyyy. If it gets too crowded try Thailand Restaurant on Castro! Has a great view from the second floor!
author: Niran L.

description:
This restaurant understands service, which is one of the reasons I choose it over 'Thai Express.' I've had Pad Thai, Pad Se Ew, Pineapple Fried Rice, and a few curries. Everything was delicious. Simple, tasty, and reasonably priced. 

At night, they really knock down the lighting and set a pretty intense date atmosphere, but they're good for groups too. They work quickly, and they're very accommodating. Thumbs up, for sure!
author: Andrew C.

description: They have very delicious thai ice tea. They have plenty of flavor in their food. They could maybe use a little more herbs though.
author: Brent N.

description: I've only had the tom yum gai soup here, but it's one of my favorites in SF. Perfect amount of spiciness, not too many leaves and stalks. It's my go-to soup when I have a head cold.
author: Jade S.

description: Best Thai place close to me. Love the crispy fish and the coconut rice! Give this place a shot... You will not be disappointed!
author: Ryan M.

description:
I have probably had food from there like 40 times and the food is consistently good, whether I order the stuff I usually order or when I feel adventurous enough to try new dishes.  Prices are reasonable.  The decor and the service are usually nice too.  

Although there are many Thai places around the area, this is certain one of the best restaurants around Castro.
author: Henry S.

description: My favorite choice among the three thai places in Castro. Get the curries or the pad kee mao, and the mango dessert! Really nice service. Don't get the tea, it is served in pots that spill everywhere.
author: Aaron W.

description: Don't let the exterior fool you.  This is really good, affordable Thai food.  The service is exceptional.  All of the wait staff are attentive and friendly.  And the chicken cashew is a unique twist on a traditional dish.
author: Russell J.

description:
Came on a Monday night.  It was packed.  My friend, who is Thai, had recommended it to me.  

Tried the Chicken Cashew dish and the Pad Thai.  Food was excellent.  Prices were reasonable ($9-$12/dish).  Ambiance was very nice.  The food came out quickly.  The staff was very down to earth and attentive.  

I don't know why this restaurant has an average of 3 stars.  This place is definitely better than that.  I would certainly come here again.
author: Naseem E.

description:
My friend recently had his birthday here about 6 pm on a Saturday night.  We had a group of about 10 people.  The waitstaff were very nice, however, they didn't come around enough to refill my water.  And they weren't very fast to bring the check, but that's my experience with most Thai restaurants.  The restaurant really began to fill up around 7:30.

The food was delicious, but the portions were average.  My friends and I shared about 10 dishes, including flavored rice, between 10 people.  It was enough to fill everyone up, but we only had a small taste of every dish.

A rough estimate of the dishes we had:  cucumber salad, chicken satay, fresh spring rolls, veggie green curry, chicken yellow curry, salmon red curry, pad thai, pad see ew, chicken cashew nut, something with prawns, ginger rice, coconut rice, garlic rice, and fried bananas at the end.  I can't remember what else we had, but it was all pretty good.

The dishes I really enjoyed were:  pad see ew, pad thai with tofu, chicken cashew nut, and garlic rice.  The pad see ew was like every other one I've had, but delicious nonetheless.  The pad thai noodles were cooked perfectly and it didn't have the weird overly vinegary taste some pad thais have!  However, it needed more side veggies and tofu.  Everyone loved the garlic chicken!  The garlic rice had a really great flavor that wasn't overpowering. 

In my opinion, there wasn't enough chicken in the yellow curry, nor enough salmon in the red curry.  They seem to be kinda skimpy on the meat and tofu here, except in the case of the chicken cashew nut.

The greatest thing about this restaurant is that I brought a birthday cake for my friend, and they were kind enough to serve it to us, birthday candle and all!

For ten people, including appetizers, two desserts, various drinks, we escaped out of there with a bill of about $165.  I'd definitely come back.
author: Jess k.

description:
The atmosphere is very pleasant at Thai Chef where you can great Thai food for a moderate prices. The lighting is low and they put effort into making the place feel trendy and welcome at the same time. I went with two friends on a Saturday evening and we were seated right after we walked in. 

I had the Green Curry Fried Rice with chicken; included were string beans, bamboo shoots included. I was an almost generous portion and spicy, making it a great dish that I recommend to anyone. I tried some of my friend's Garlic Rice and it was amazing. It's something different and delicious! 

Overall, great Thai place, reasonably priced for the dishes and the atmosphere. And it's location only a half-block from Castro St. on 18th makes it a convenient Thai spot.
author: Phil H.

description: This has been our first choice for take out for a couple of years and its been consistently great.  They really seem to care a lot about how the food comes out. We had a native Thai friend come through town and she spoke with them in Thai and said they were the real thing.
author: Haney A.

description:
This is my favorite local Thai restaurant.  The service is always exceptional!.  The staff always remember you, welcome you back, and make you feel special.  

The decor and cleanliness of the space is very good.  The candle lanterns and overall ambiance is really nice, especially at night.

The food is awesome, fast and really affordable.  I've tried so many things on the menu and quite honestly, I've not had a bad dish.  Certainly there are my favorites like the crispy basil chicken, duck in red curry with tomatoes & pineapple, chicken with coconut milk soup, and even the pad thai is awesome.  One of my favorite dishes is the mixed seafood salad, with iceberg lettuce and lime/chili dressing.  I always order this dish fried and it's just delicious, with tons of scallops, shrimp, calamari, etc.

So, when you're in the Castro and need a quick, clean, fresh, delicious and CHEAP meal, try the Thai Chef.  The food AND the service will keep you coming back.
author: Vance P.

description:
Met my friends for dinner in the Castro and we couldn't decide what to eat.  We all never tried this place so we decided to give it a go.  It was a little past 7pm and was pretty empty... I think there was 2 other tables seated.  

Anyway... we started out with an appetizer which was the fried tofu with peanut sauce.. and for entrees we ordered the Panang Curry, Roasted Duck, and Sauteed Eggplant.  I think the Panang Curry was one of the worst curries I have ever had.  I'm not saying that it was horrible... but the curry was very runny like water rather than a consistency of what curry should be.  The eggplant was kind of forgettable... but we all agreed the roasted duck was very very good.. flavorful and tasty!

The food came out pretty quickly, the service was good, and the prices seem fair.  I cant say I would recommend this place or not recommend it.  The food was average.
author: Jasen L.

description:
Watered down Thai food is not cool!

OK, I've been to Thailand and loved it!  Not just to Bangkok, but to the Isan, the Mekong River border, Suphanburi, Loei, Ayuthaya, etc.  I know what Thai food is supposed to taste like.  Hell!  Thai people are convinced I'm actually Thai!  Even after showing my CA driver's license, one post office worker could still identify my origins to a specific Thai province.  Weird!

Anyway, I understand that some restaurants adjust flavors to accommodate the American taste buds, but this is ridiculous!  Fresh spring rolls smothered in tamerind sauce should not taste slightly better than murky sewer water.  Also, the panang curry and pad gra prow are nothing to write home about.  You'll probably fall asleep before you finish the letter.

Our waiter sucked!  The only words we heard were, "You ready to order?"  We didn't hear "How is the food?", "Do you need more water?", "Are you done?", "Can I take your check?", etc.  But he was unusually friendly when we were walking out!  He finally looked us in the eyes and smiled enthusiastically.  To think of it, this behavior has been consistent during all my visits.  Not good.

The one star is for the ultra-nice hostess and the woman who took our payment.  Yes I ate what I ordered, but would I ever got back?  Probably not.  I've eaten there maybe 5 times, and I've ordered "to go" maybe 3 times.  After that many tries, I've finally realized that this place just doesn't serve good Thai food.  Yes, it's edible, but so is dog food.  That doesn't necessarily mean that it tastes like Thai food.  We had our leftovers packaged to go, but we probably won't eat them.  (Now that's saying a lot because I was raised a poor-ass mofo!)

It's pretty ironic that their website says "Kiss boring Thai goodbye!"  Did they taste their food?!
author: Vicente G.

description:
Although we are still learning about Thai food, this is the best we have had in SF! The pad thai, the HEAVEN PRAWNS, the chicken sate...all of it was absolutely delicious. The food is HOT, presented in a pleasant fashion and deeeeelicious! The only thing better there is the wonderfully friendly/informative waitstaff. "O" can answer any questions you may have and is responsive and helpful if you are unsure. GREAT food, friendly staff, convenient location and never a disappointment...this is the place to go for Thai food if you are anywhere near the Castro! BRAVO!
YUMMMMMM!
author: Xenry W.

description: Stumbled upon this restaurant a while ago and the food was great.  Not certain of customer service since I was in there off peak lunch hours.  The 2nd time was as good and the older lady that was working there was very nice.  Very nice little spot if you want a good place for lunch.
author: Paul G.

description: Decent Thai food until I tried the pumpkin curry. I'm now hooked on this place forever. Run, don't walk. Run to Thai Chef and try the pumpkin curry. It's served in a half pumpkin and there are so many different layers to the flavors that my mouth is watering just thinking about it. Other meals I enjoy there include Pad Thai and Yellow Curry and Veggies. I wish they had more vegetarian appetizers without seafood, but the menu is otherwise pretty extensive.  The ambience is peaceful. It's quiet and the service is fast. Prices are very reasonable too. A great neighborhood Thai place!!
author: John C.

description:
One of my fav's in the Castro.. Service is always good Green Currie Chicken is a good bet.

Send my friends there when they ask about Thai food never had a complaint yet! in fact they became fans...
author: Mark M.

description: Service was ok. But both dishes we had, the pumpkin curry with chicken and a broccoli dish with pork had very little meat. The dishes were tasty but when you are paying $10+/dish I expect to see the meat and not have to dig around for it. I also felt that a scoop of brown rice for $2.50 ($5 for 2) was way out of line.
author: Bill B.

description: I eat here about once a week. The food is wonderful. Tom Yum Soup, Tom Ka Soup, Pad Thai, Pram Ram Garlic Basil Eggplant all the food is delicious I havent had anything there that I didnt like. Super friendly staff and great waiters. This is my top choice for Thai food in the Castro.
author: Jake T.

description:
I usually go to Thai Chef for dinner once a month with a friend.  The food is always tasty and reasonably priced.  As a vegetarian, I particularly like the soy "fish."

What really stands out is the fact that my friend and I can have a real dinner conversation without loud music and distracting conversations around us.

And the icing on the cake is the staff.  They are always gracious and solicitous without being overly attentive.

Dinners here have always been a nice experience.
author: Stephen S.

description:
came back for dinner:

i must say that it was a lot better then my lunch experience, though my lunch experience wasnt bad. the food overall was pretty good this time the dinner consisted of:

-Salmon Salad
Salmon with lemon grass, ginger, red & green onions, mint leaves and lemon dressing

-Garlic Pepper Beef
Pan fried garlic & pepper with Beef

-Sautéed Eggplant
Sautéed tofu eggplant w/bean sauce, garlic, chili & basil

-Yellow Curry
Yellow curry w/coconut milk, carrots, potatoes, chicken & onions, served w/cucumber salad

the best dish this time was the sautéed Eggplant, excellent favors and just really well done. the curry was good, maybe just a little dry but not bad. the least favorite was the garlic pepper beef. 

another added bonus was the carafe they brought for the iced tea we had ordered and the cute little tea pot for the hot tea. they still had those little added touches like the rose origami on the straw.
author: Tofer M.

description:
