For a casual (no need to dress up) and dimly lit place to eat, this place to yummy for the low prices that they charge.   I usually go there for lunch.  

hey have daily Lunch specials that are really reasonable.  Plus that men that work their are very polite and most of them are very cute too.  I have eaten there about 6 times and  the service has always been consistent and attentive.  

Thai Chef Spring Rolls, these are the kind that are not fried and are very good. I love the dipping sauce that comes with it.  One day when I was not feeling well, I ordered the Tom Ka Soup  with coconut and lemon grass et. al.  Loved the texture and of course the lemon grass really gives it a kick.

Try their  fried Angel Prawns (they are not greasy, and they are very crispy)
they are coated with a coconut & bread crumb mixture and served with a sweet  plum sauce.  I have had so many dishes here, that I can write a long list but I'll stop with that.

The bathrooms are nice and clean and a wheel chair can get in their as well as the restaurant.  The atmosphere is quiet is  is decorated with dark toned colors.
author: Vanilla C.

description:
Love this place ! Food is great, delivery and service is wonderful. 
One of my favorite places for Thai.
author: Richard F.

description: Good Thai food. Friendly service. Been coming here for a long time.
author: Daniel A.

description:
I've been here a few times and the food is decent, but not spectacular. The fresh rolls are okay, the pad see ew is decent and the papaya salad is slightly bland but the best part is how they create little roses out of the straws for your beverages, it's adorable! 

I'd go back since it's in the neighborhood but I do like the Thai food at Thai Express up on 19th and Castro a little better. My roommates really love Thai Chef so I think I need to check it out again until I find the right dish!
author: Tyler J.

description:
We love this place! Ever since I moved out of SF, I still crave the noodles here. I can't find another thai place as good as this place in SF. 

I've had the pad thai, pad se yew, chicken satay, deep fried soft shell crab, beef salad, and much more. You not only get your food, but you get a presentation on your plate. They make it look are pretty and colorful.

I'd have to say, this place is good because the service is great. The waiters constantly go out of their way to make sure your cup is never empty and that you're enjoying your food. 

Prices here range from $10/lunch specials to full on meals for $15/person. I mean...isn't that great? The many years I have dined here, I don't believe I ever spent more than $20.
author: Nancy T.

description: My go-to takeout place.  Pad Thai and Pad See Euw are consistently good and reasonably priced.  So far, out of the ~5 Thai restaurants in SF I've tried, this one is the best (why is it so hard to get Thai food right?).
author: Michael C.

description:
I really wanted to give this place a 4 star rating.. it's more like 3.5... but there were a few things off... 

First off the Good

Basil Duck- Amazing! So delicious... fatty... salty... sweet... tangy .. GREAT! 

Nigori Sake- $8 for the whole bottle .. totally fair .. reasonably priced this will make we come here

Thai Iced Tea- Tall glasses ... delicious!

Decor- Love it... not enough Thai places are date worthy 

Brown Rice- Amazing.. like the brown rice you get in thailand and Indonesia when you order it

Now the bad 

Red Curry- Not spicy in any way ... maybe i should have asked for it to be spicy ... but I think med to low spicy goes without saying ... also... kind of tasted a little fishy .. not sure why ,.. cause we ordered chicken ... not a lot of veggies in it either .. even though I asked for extra veggies 

Pricing- A bit overpriced .. granted .. you are in a high rent area... and the place IS nice... but our bill was about $65  with appy, two dishes, bottle of Sake and two thai iced teas.. $50 would be more chill .. 

Service- Had to flag down our guy a few times... even though the place was pretty empty .. not good... especially for a new place. 

I will peep it again for lunch ... and maybe if they deliver :)
author: Jeremy R.

description:
I ordered from this place through their online option at 7:55pm. It is now 8:35. I just received a call from the place and they are going to be an additional 45 minutes! I understand that they are busy but seriously?! 

I offered to pick it up and he said that would be longer (????) and then when i told him that i was going to cancel he said it would be here by 9.

all of a sudden i have lost my appetite.
author: Audrey T.

description: Very satisfied with the service and the food. Everything was quick and delicious. Delightful to have lunch here!
author: Junyong P.

description:
Boo, I want my money back.  And if the little one in the front could do that without the stinky look on his face, that'd be great, thanks.  

I've been here before (take out) and wasn't so thrilled about their oily Pad Thai (a pretty good benchmark for a thai food joint....).  Yesterday I stopped on my way home and got some Thom Ka soup which was terrible.  If you're curious, just go get a bowl of lime juice, splash it with coconut milk, heat it and viola, you'll have the same thing I got.  It was so bad I actually comtemplated walking myself back down the hill to get something else, but the thought of walking up again deterred me.  

I'm giving this place 2 stars because it's on my way home (translation= I'm too lazy to walk the extra block and a half to the other place on Castro and 19th) and I have ordered food before that hasn't totally sucked.

When will the Castro get better food options... WHEN?
author: Laura S.

description: Always fast!  Good Thai iced tea to go. Strong and sweet, (reminds me of an old girlfriend of mine).  lol
author: Cynthia B.

description:
We went there with a bunch of friends, there were 4 of us. 
We went there because one of us saw a coupon that stated 'free salad and soup per person, per table" with purchase of entree. 

We gave our order and the coupon to our server, a tall young asian man.

He then brought out one single serving salad.  We said '" we had a coupon for free salad and soup" he then left without saying anything bringing back the coupon and pointing to the coupon stating in a very condecending tone "it says right on the coupon per person" we said you mean we have to bring in 4 coupons, he replied, yes and left the 4 of us there with only the one tiny salad and tiny soup. 

This was very poor customer service and the food was very mediocre. 
The waiter never came back once to ask how everything was, never refilled our water and only made an appearance when we asked for the bill. 

None of us will ever go back and one of us is a concierge.
author: Michael C.

description:
We shared 4 entrees, and all 4 things were very good: the Pad Kee Mao, Crispy Basil (w/chicken), Green Curry, and Pineapple Fried Rice.  The amount of spice and heat in each dish was just right -- enough of a kick, but not so much that it overpowers all the other flavors in the dish.

It is rare to see a Thai restaurant do noodles, curry, and rice dishes so equally well.  The prices are a little higher than average (probably a couple more dollars per item), but the taste and consistency make it worth it.
author: Leslie L.

description: This place honestly has the best thai food I have ever had in California. it's amazing!!! everything I have ordered I have loved, and the service is always great! If you like thai food you will not be disappointed with thai chef, guaranteed
author: Cara S.

description:
WTF?

I ate here a lot when I lived in SF and it WAS great. There must be a new owner or management because everything has slipped. The food, presentations and staff are all below average for such a nice room. Sure I'm disappointed the cute waiters are all gone and they stopped doing Friday nights in drag....but I'm really sad they let the place go down hill like this.

WAKE UP CALL GUYS!
author: JayChan H.

description:
I gauge my thai restaurants based on their pad thai.   

Unless you're making a baked noodle pudding or are reheating noodles from the night before, they should never stick together.  This is a basic tenant of noodles.  Half the fun of eating noodles is the slide through your mouth into your throat.  If you need a knife to get a bite of noodles, something is wrong.

Getting rice noodles right is difficult.  A bit too much time and they become a sticky rice noodle cake.  Too little and each bite has a crunch.  

Do you know what isn't difficult?  

Making new noodles!  

Vegetarian note: The fried tofu was pretty good.
author: Mat K.

description:
I've eaten here twice.  Both times I've ordered the vegetarian Pad Thai.  Both times I've had pieces of spoiled tofu mixed into my Pad Thai.  The first time I went,  the piece of spoiled tofu was so awful I had to spit it out.  

I recently decided to give the place another chance and what do you know!  It happened again!  I'm done giving this place a chance.  They must mix older tofu in with the new tofu and somehow they are allowing tofu that has just plain gone bad into their dishes!  Really disgusting!

Besides that.  The dishes just arent that great.  The noodles in my Pad Thai were one big stuck-together lump ... and a bit greasy as well.
author: Daniel S.

description:
San Francisco is a cultural melting pot and the diverse makeup of its citizens gives us all an opportunity to learn from one another. 

For example: I just learned that "pad gra prow" is Thai for ground chicken tartar with basil.  I never would have learned on my own.  When I order thai food, I usually expect the meat to be in chunks, not in grade C ground form, especially at these prices.  Also, if you are going to serve ground meat, it shouldn't be difficult to ensure that you actually cook it.  Who the hell orders their chicken done rare? It wasn't just my dish either, my roommate and our friend both ordered chicken curry, and the chicken WAS STILL RED/PINK in the middle. 

My Thom E. Coli soup was nasty as well.  This might just be the worst Thai restaurant in the city.  They get one star for actually giving us a refund (but only for the undercooked dishes).
author: Josh K.

description:
I started getting takeout from here after a place that I shall not name (but is located on the corner of Castro and 19th) gave me the worst food poisoning from what I suspect was undercooked shrimp and squid.  I thought I'd be put off Thai food for life, but how can a girl survive in SF without eating Thai?

Consistently good - their Pad Thai and Basil Chicken have become my comfort food.  Plus they deliver - added bonus!  Their food could stand to be a bit spicier from time to time, but all you have to do is ask.  Sometimes the takeout can take a little longer than I would expect, but after my previous experience at the place-that-shall-not-be-named, I'll take a 20 minute wait for thoroughly cooked food any day of the week.
author: Isabel G.

description:
Consistently good Thai food.  

The ginger fish is a delicious (but too well-hidden on the menu) dish, and the cashew chicken is wonderful.  The brown rice is tasty, and the service is uber-friendly (even though they're Thai, not German).

And, if you need a good ol' standard, the pad Thai is also consistently good.

But somebody turn up the lights - it's always so dark in here, so you almost always walk by it 30 times before you know it's there.
author: Evan G.

description: The lunch special is a couple bucks beyond the "what a bargain" range, but the food was A-OK.
author: Will R.

description: Once I sat and dined for the first time on January 12, 2011, I have been in twice or three times a week since then depending on my work schedule.  Everyone there staff and patrons have a big smile on their face.  Cuisine and service both exceed excellence.
author: Guillermo D.

description: It was the worst vegetarian fried rice I have ever had! No vegetables only rice in it. Il you are in the neighborhood go to Thai house express on Castro street, the fried rices are really good.
author: V. A.

description:
their service is very fast, unbelievable. it's definitelly better than other fast food, in here you cld eat fast, n healthy too. Probably bcs thr were not so many people too whn i came, cuz i came around 3pm :p
the staff are all pretty friendly ( except whn i already paid, the staff was kinda forgot where he put the restaurant copy bill, ha ha u sleepy head, he has it!! ..) Anywayszzz....
the pineapple fried rice was excellent, also tried the Pha Ram also really good if you like veggies tofu  with thai peanut sauce, & you cld request a brown rice too here. 
will definitiely come back to try out other food here.
author: Ms C.

description:
To be honest, Thai Chef has never disappointed nor pleasantly surprised me.

They offer the traditional dishes found in other Thai restaurants.  While the curries are a hit & miss a few times I was there, their Pad Thai and Raad Na have been excellent for the most part.

Prices are reasonable considering they are in Castro district.  I am sure that you will find cheaper prices if you opt to walk around Tenderloin and other seedy parts of the city.  

The staff (waiters/waitresses, servers and bussers) are always very friendly.  They are very easy to talk to, and offer suggestions when asked.  I have always thought Thai people are nice and respectful and folks here do just that!  They cannot pass by your table without smiling!  

The place itself is very well-lighted, but dim enough so there's an air of romance should you decide to bring a date with you.  I have, at times, seen couples (straight and gay) holding hands or gazing at each other's eyes.  Now, I guess it depends on your marital status...that kind of PDA may either nauseate you, make you feel jealous, or make you feel all gooey inside with happy feelings!

I have eaten at this place on a regular monthly basis and does not hesitate in recommending it when friends want to go to a rather inexpensive Thai restaurant with good ambiance.

I would give it a 3.5...but since there are no half stars..I'm rounding it off to a 4!
author: Andy P.

description: I wanted to like this place more since this neighborhood has no good Thai food anywhere.  Unfortunately, the thai food here was just OK.  The tofu was really boring and the rest of it had decent flavor.  It wasn't bad, but I wouldn't seek it out.
author: Jonathan U.

description:
Give me sticky rice or give me death.

I like Thai Chef because it's yummy and close to my apartment.

They have great Thai beer there!!!!!  I was drunk after only one.  (I swear I don't have a problem.)

I had the BBQ Beef most recently and it came with this REALLY HOT sauce.  My mother was on fire.  (Mouth!  Shit, I was wasted last night and up early this morning.  I'm keeping it though, because frankly my mother is on fire.)
author: David M.

description:
This joint is three doors down from my office, and every time I pass, I'm tempted to reassign this place a new name: Thai Side-Effects. Everything tastes sour, probably because nearly every dish is drowned in the same goop, which always manages to ooze all over the table. 

They also have a problem with serving something as simple as tea (which usually turns out to be Lipton if you open your teapot). The lighting is all wrong, there are many uncomfortable "microclimates" waiting to nip at your nose, and the servers sometimes get your order wrong (though they'll take the blame and correct it).  

Sigh. San Francisco.
author: Daniel C.

description: Thai Chef, you are everything I hope to find in a man someday. Dependable, tasty, visually presentable, consistent AND you bring me food when I'm sick. When I visit in person, you bring me a cute little paper flower with my dinner. As an added bonus, you're within walking distance when I'm not sick. Thank you, your loyal neighbor.
author: Erin A.

description:
So I've been here quite a few times and the ONLY reason I continue to go here is because it is a convenient location in the heart of the castro next to Badlands.  If this restaurant were anywhere else I would avoid it like the plague.  Every time the service is below average at best but the last time was the absolute worse.  Yes I admit this was a busy Sunday evening but the cheap owner should hire more staff on the weekends rather than subject the single waiter to run the entire restaurant.  After seating us the waiter never came over so about 15 mins later the hostess came over to our table to take our orders.  I ordered the Tom Yum soup with chicken and fresh garden rolls, my friend ordered the chicken friend rice.  Thirty minutes later a chef in the kitchen only brought my friend's dish over and it was completely wrong!  The guy who brought out the tray tried to make excuses for the wrong dish and then tried to get my friend to accept the wrong dish!  But we insisted that he go back to the kitchen and bring what he ordered.  Meanwhile my order was no where to be found and when I asked the chef he acted like he didnt know what I was talking about.  About 15 minutes later another chef (I assume) finally brought out my friend's chicken fried rice while my order never appeared.  I asked the guy where my food was and he said he would check.  He never came back.   Finally about 20 minutes later I asked the hostess where my food was and she ran to the kitchen and came back five minutes later and said they forgot to make it.  Then she walked away.  No apologies, nothing.  So after waiting for about 15 more minutes I ate half of my friends dinner and as we were about to leave they finally brought out my dinner.  When we told the guy we were leaving he looked at us like we were completely crazy.  I told him we had been there for over an hour and I never got my food and we were leaving.  I asked them to put my food in a To Go bag.  About ten minutes later they came out with my food to go along with a complimentary iced tea.  That's it?  I sit in this restaurant for over an hour with no food and they give me a free iced tea?  When I asked if they would take my order off the bill the hostess looked away and asked an older guy (who I assume was the owner) to come over.  He was incredibly rude and said we were to pay the bill in full.  Are you kidding me?!  This place is a total joke and I would not recommend it for anyone, no matter how drunk you are when you leave Badlands.  

If you want mediocre service with hateful staff who dont care at all about customers then I highly recommend this joke of a restaurant.  There are plenty of amazing restaurants in San Francisco and this is not one of them.  Go somewhere else.
author: Robbie T.

description:
Thai Chef is one of those restaurants on Yelp with such polarized reviews.

I have not had the negative experience that some have written about.  I can be a big snob when it comes to Thai food.  But, I can't say anything I've eaten anything bad here.  

I dig the cashew chicken the most.

The biggest thing that bothers me about Thai Chef is the food is bland.  There is no kick to anything.  Maybe it's the clientle that frequents Thai Chef that makes the owners feel they have to dumb down their food.

If you're in the area and aching for Thai, check this place out.
author: Diego S.

description:
This is a simple solid Thai restaurant. I didn't really get to try their main dishes but what I had was good.

- Prawns Papaya Salad ($7.95) - nice tangy papaya salad. But I think you only get 4 "prawns".
- Chicken Sa-Tay ($7.95) - I'm typically ambivalent about satays, but this was suprisingly good. Nutty curry flavor, very tender chicken. About 6 skewers. 
- Sweet Sticky Rice with Mango ($4.50) - I can easily make a meal out of this! Yum! warm sticky rice and fresh mango. Great presentation with the mango slices too.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Had the opportunity to finally take a seat at this restaurant. First I do want to give a big huge compliment about the food , the chef really blends it all with taste and express the Thai characteristic on his food brilliantly.
My only one disappointment were the servants/ waiters, they were completely rude towards a friend who was ordering and at times not even waiting her to finish speaking. Their flair of condescendence could be felt from miles away, making the evening much less pleasurable. When my friend asked a glass of water in room temperature, the waiter had the guts to say "there is no room temperature in this restaurant, all our waters are refrigerated "
The funniest thing was when we finished eating and the bill was thrown on table without even being asked about desserts. 
Well , I don't need to say that my I made a huge effort to at least tip them with something, although honestly they didn't deserve a penny... SO I gave them 10 % and they were even rude, laughing and talking in they own native language loud. 
It was a disappointing experience and I am sure now that despite de tasty food we can get in there, I am never inviting another friend over .
author: Rafael T.

description:
I stopped in here with my brother for lunch, and I really enjoyed it!  The decor is nice, though the lighting seemed strange given the dark interior with the bright light coming from the building across the street.  The dishes they served on were nice, especially the soup dish shape!

The food quality was good as well.  For the lunch specials, you get your choice of two dishes, which comes with salad and soup.  The salad was small, but but tasty, and the soup was delicious!  I had the yellow curry and the BBQ pork, both of which satisfied.  The portions were just right!
author: Corey C.

description: Went here for dinner with some friends. The inside looks very nice for a Thai restaurant. Food was great and so were the thai iced teas!!
author: Alex C.

description:
Pretty damn good, if you ask me.

I am completely obsessed with their Tom Ka soup, which is definitely some of the best I've had.  The green papaya salad and shrimp rolls are fantastic, and I've never had a problem with service.  

It is a bit difficult to order over the phone, but they deliver quickly when you do.

Just as a side note to Eric M., food poisoning typically occurs 24 hours (or more) after you've eaten something.  Whatever you're sick from was probably the day before.  I'm not saying that it couldn't have occurred from what you ate at this restaurant, but is more common to react after a longer incubation period.
author: louda l.

description:
Service was impeccable, very friendly and attentive, no rush to get us out even when the place was filling up.

Appetizers are spectacular, desserts are masterpieces.  But every entree I've had here has been bland at best.

Probably won't go back... they have this nutty system of serving food where some people get served and others at the table sit there waiting.  I went with 2 friends the other night.  My dinner came and I didn't want to be rude so I didn't start eating, and the rest of the food came dribbling out over the next 10-15 minutes.  By the time everyone was served, my dinner was room temperature and I had to gag it down.   (Maybe they thought we were sharing entrees or something and wanted a slow pipeline of food deliveries to the table.)

Bottom line: Nice place, but if you're not sharing the entrees then tell the server to make sure they serve everything at the same time.
author: Daniel L.

description: I can't believe I decided to eat here. I have no idea that this Thai place tasted very plain and dull I should have known by it's title "THAI CHEF". But, this is what I ordered "Pad Kee Mao" that was a chow fun version.
author: Angelica A.

description:
I first dined here with a Thai friend who told me it was the best in the area. I returned several times and it just kept getting better. The last time I chose here on May 2, 2009 was for my birthday dinner with a friend and it (other than the coconut cake a friend made for me earlier in the day) was the best part of my birthday celebration.

If you are lucky enough to get one of the handsome devil waiters O or J you will experience not only excellent service but friendly as hell.

I can't recommend specific dishes because I'm sure they are all good. I don't eat Pad Thai however (so typically something an American would order) so I'll never be able to tell you how theirs is.
author: Lee S.

description:
Ate here for my first time tonight.  I didn't have a bad experience but it was nothing to write home about...

Heaven Prawns were ok.
Beef salad...had better before
Crispy fried duck loaded with grease (yes I know duck is fatty...but it was overly greasy)

Company was great though and service was superb.
author: Matt V.

description:
It's overall a decent place to get a bite to eat.

Try the tamarind fish!  And the stuffed chicken wings!  The more random stuff on the menu seems to be better than the typical pad thai, satay sticks options that many people seem to order.

Prices ok. Service quick. And waitstaff nice... decent choice for castro (considering there really isn't anything really super to eat in the castro... sadly)
author: Alex D.

description: It's close. They deliver. Go to Thai House Express if you feel like leaving the house.
author: Mike E.

description:
Just went to grab a light meat and ordered one of their seafood soups - it was good and also their sampling of "meat balls" - fish, shrimp, beef, you get the point.  They were all very tasty.  Lastly the service was great.

Deserves going back to :o)
author: Tiberius A.

description:
The spring rolls, red curry, and pad thai were yummy.  This will probably become my go-to for thai takeout.

Minus one star because when I forgot to order rice to go with my curry, it didn't occur to anyone there to ask, "hey, didn't she mean to order rice?"  So, I didn't get rice.  Maybe that was my responsibility, but I just don't feel that they earned that so-good-they-almost-read-your-mind kind of five-star review.
author: Caroline O.

description: I was craving some Thai food and walked into Thai Chef around 6:00 pm on a weeday. There were a few diners, but plenty of seating. Service was prompt and courteous and selection plentiful. I was famished and ordered both the green curry with chicken and the chicken pad thai. Had an order of brown rice as well. The food was out quickly and the meal was oh so tasty! Prices are reasonable for the amount and quality of food. I'll certainly be back!
author: Mrk P.

description: I ordered a soup from Thai Chef using the gopago app and they delivered it two hours late, only after calling them! The delivery guy still had the nerve to ask for a tip and when I refused, he said he will never deliver to my address again. I felt like in a Seinfeld episode :-)
author: Erhan E.

description: I eat at this place at least once a month. I usually eat an Eggplant dish they have in the Main Entree menu. Last night was very disappointing (considering that it was Valentine's day) The Eggplant was not cooked well and the  chicken addd at my request was minimal. there where about 8 nail size pieces of chicken between the huge pieces of uncooked eggplant. What happen? ....
author: E M.

description: They only Thai place I eat at. Great service and awesome food. The BBQ beef on white rice is very filling and perfectly seasoned. I always order the Tom ka soup spicy and have fried bananas with honey for dessert. The menu is priced right too.
author: Ryan M.

description:
OK, this is not food related, so no opinion on the food.  And maybe I am being a bit petty given this is partly my fault, but I tried to order online, went through the whole process, placing the order, setting up an account, giving my billing address, etc.  Apparently when I entered my credit card number, I messed up on a digit.  So, they did try to call, but I did not get the call (I was away from my cell).  So I went to go pick it up and that's when they told me they did not cook the food and I would have to wait the 15-20 minutes if I wanted it. 

I asked him why he did not just go ahead and do the food since I was coming in, but said he has had people in the past not pick up food.  Like is that not a risk with any call in to a restaurant?  I have given him my address and phone number (which he can confirm is valid since he called it) and he still did not cook the food.  

OK, maybe this is petty but I was in rush, double parked and then come home with no food.  So it pissed me off.
author: Jay S.

description: Very reasonable for standard Thai fare. I had the privilege of lunching here with a friend earlier today. Gorgeous host! Shame I can't remember, but I believe my friend had the pad kee mao, which he seemed to have enjoyed, as well as his order of tom ka soup with chicken. I had not had pad thai in so long, and was happy to try Thai Chef 2's rendition of the dish. The overarching flavor I got, even after generous squeezes of lemon, was mostly sweet. I did run into one pocket of spicy (which I could have increased if I had asked for condiments, but decided against), but thought the traditional mix of spicy, sour, sweet, salty, and possibly even bitter could have been more present in the dish. Beautiful presentation, and timely, friendly service. So three-and-half stars for flavor, but four stars overall. Did I mention the host was hot?
author: Ryan T.

description:
It's basically take-out Thai, but with tables if you want to eat there.   The beer and wine list is REALLY short and REALLY from aisle 3 at 7Eleven, so if you have a table at home and anything that's a step up from Bud Light (not kidding) or cooking sherry, I'd get your food to go.  I like the food and service at Thailand Restaurant better (plus it's family owned), but Thai Chef delivers.  Cold + Rain = Tolerance for Average.  Most of the food I've had at Thai Chef is ok - not great, not bad.  Haricot vert in the panang curry chicken is a little odd, but not a big deal and otherwise good.  The green curry fried rice is really good as a share plate.  Even with chicken or beef, there are better options if it's the only thing you're ordering.  The appetizers are very average, basically things that have been fried.  Hard to mess that up, but nothing stands out.  One thing I have to point out, they serve the absolute worst pad thai I've ever had.  It's cloying, sweet and syrupy with overcooked starchy noodles.   I asked for some lime to cut through the sweetness (isn't that normally served with Pad Thai anyway???) and the server brought back lemon.  I said, "No, I meant lime" and he walked away and returned with a bigger plate of lemons.

Service has been really hospitable on most occassions, but one night we were sitting at our table waiting to be served and they brought our food out in take-out containers bagged and ready to go because, well, it seems that they were ready to go.

I'd rather give it 2.5 stars, but I know I'll keep eating here so I'm rounding up.  In short, if you're walking by and it's that time of day, there are worse places to stop.    Otherwise, it isn't any better than the 3 other Thai restaurants you could walk to in any neighborhood.
author: P J.

description: A friend and I recently ordered take out for our movie night in from here. All the years I've been living in Castro I have never been here which is so odd. We had the food delivered, and it got to my home in a very reasonable about of time, just as we had ordered! We ordered about 5 items, and all were very good. I used grubhub.com and even got a confirmation call from the restaurant making sure everything was correct. The prices were very reasonable, and overall it wasn't the best Thai I've ever had, but for the money and the speed of delivery, it was a great value! I'll definitely try it again sit-down next time I am in the area, and in the mood for Thai!
author: Ryan B.

description: Best Thai iced tea in the city. Delicious health-conscious lunch and at a great price.  Very nice waiters.  Looking forward to going back and trying out more of their menu.
author: Len M.

description: Thai Chef is right on the mark every time I eat there. No matter how packed they are, they never make you wait for your food, and it is always fresh - the rice is always searing hot...never dried out. The Chicken Pad Thai is excellent, and you get a ton of it (enough for two hearty meals). The fried veggie spring rolls are a must try as well!
author: Ron M.

description: I used to love this place. Every time I walked by I would think about the food. Not anymore. Ordered take out that was so bad we had to throw it out. No real vegetables in the curry and the spicy tofu and basil dish came as sweet and sour rubber. Now I don't even like looking at the awning. Too bad!
author: Linda G.

description: The service is always beyond the call of duty. They are fast and efficient. The food is impeccable. My favorite is the Cashew Nut Chicken, which I order with a side of brown rice. Delicious! The dining environment is very nice. The bonus is the going-ons in the Castro outside the window.
author: Josh M.

description: Once we figured out that they delivered to our neighborhood (which took some time), we had a good experience.  The food arrived in less than 30 minutes and was the appropriate tempurature.  One complaint:  The fried rice dish was so hot it melted the plastic container in which it was deliered.  The highlight:  It was the best panang beef I have had in a VERY long time.  And I LOVE the corn cakes!  YUM!
author: Fred S.

description: After a soggy mishap the first time  got take out here, Thai Chef has very quickly become one of my favorite neighborhood take out places. Just like most asian take out places, it takes a little while until you learn what you like off their menu, for me it's the veggie pra-ram and tofu satay.
author: Allyson S.

description: My friend mary and i went here on a friday night.  We walked in, and it was almost empty. A place in castro almost empty at 7pm ish on a Friday? Scary. We sat down and there were pictures on the menu... Pictures are usually scary too... The waiter was very attentive.  The thai iced tea was pretty good, insanely tall. I'm a short person and could barely reach the top of the straw.  M had a green curry i think, and really liked it. I had a shrimps eggplant thing, and it was also good. The food was pretty good, averageish.  The bathroom was clean.  I think the reason it was so empty must have been the lack of atmosphere.  I think most castro places are ok, good, but people go there for the castro-ish atmosphere. it just wasnt there at this restaurant. So, if the other thai places are full, and you're in the area, go here, you're sure to be seated and not go away hungry.
author: Merredith L.

description: yummy thai place! service was great. everyone was super nice. some friends and i came for dinner and were seated right away. there were so many things on the menu that looked good so we decided to just get a bunch of things and share. we ordered the tom yum soup, soft shell crab and fried rice, pad see iew, and green curry. everything was super yummy and affordable! i would definitely come back if i happen to be in the area.
author: Linda N.

description: Ok, well, when I first went hear a year ago, just after seeing Eating Out at the Castro Theatre, my friend and I went here, having recently seen it reviewed in the SFBG. I rather liked it, we had the Friday night drag (which I read in other Yelps has ended?!), and the food was good. The papaya salad was very good, and so was the pad kee mao ped (A spicy hot noodle dish with chili and sweet basil and duck breast, ped = duck in Thai). I ate here a second time a few months ago, and even though it wasn't on the menu or specials, they still brought me this duck dish (and I'm usually a fish man). Saturday nights are purportedly Thigh night (get it?!). Sorry to hear the place has gone downhill. La Moone is gone too. And Tallulla. I guess the Castro is back to mediocre craptitude for food...
author: Hao L.

description: The servers here are AMAZING! I love them all (well, the ones that I've met). Extremely friendly, laid-back; you feel like you are eating at their home and they are the most well-intentioned, good-humored and welcoming hosts ever. The service is fast and straightforward, water refills constant, no need for a reservation last minute on a Monday (holiday) evening. The brown rice is delicious is definitely worth the extra $0.50, and the yellow curry, pad thai, and pad kee mao were delicious. We asked for extremely spicy, and only the curry was mildly spicy, but they brought out a rack of spices for our use if needed; this would be my only complaint- not enough heat. I loved that the food was very light though, for a Thai restaurant, as I generally feel a bit over-stuffed and heavy after a single Thai dish (if I can finish it), but here I felt great and satisfied. Not to say that it wasn't enough food, but it seemed healthier and less just overcooked in too much oil. Definitely check these guys out! It's not the most amazing Thai food I've had, but it is, so far, in California. The mango sticky rice for dessert was also delicious, and the mango was perfect.
author: Amanda S.

description: Food is great.  The music they play in the restaurant is awful and ruins the atmosphere.  If you've lost your hearing or don't mind bad restaurant music, definitely go.  Otherwise, order for takeout.  It's great food!!!
author: Lisa A.

description: Went here on a Saturday night.  Only had to wait about five minutes for a table.  We got a tasty appetizer, and the spicy basil chicken and sauteed eggplant.  It was all very tasty and the service was friendly and fast.  We also had a beer and a glass of wine.  The price was reasonable, and the food was very good.  We will be back, and will recommend this place to others.
author: Corey H.

description:
Thai Me Up... 

... and slap me silly with flat noodles!  In the heart of the Castro, a casual place for tasty food, nice service, and reasonable prices.   Dinner for two with drinks around $40.  Go back?  All the time.

Place/Service.  A simple box of a space with a modern edge and touches of asiatic accents.  Usually not a problem grabbing a table unless you come with a big party, but even then the tables are easily configured, and eating alone here is just fine too.  The reception is always friendly unless the host is distracted by too many takeout orders; the initial service is sometimes spotty, but once your order is in, the food comes quickly. 

Food/Beverage.  Of the many Thai restaurants in the City, I find the food here fresh and delicious.  Definitely a fun place to go with a group so that many dishes can be ordered and shared family-style.*  As with all ethnic cuisines, there are many styles, and I happen to like the offerings here.  Be it spicy or not, I find that the ingredients of every dish all pop with distinctive taste and texture.  Examples: the claypot seafood will have your senses swimming as soon as the lid is uncovered and the fragrant, curried steam rises from the morsels of fish, shellfish and vegetables; even the simple pad see eiw with beef is a perfect combination of soft wide noodles, tender marinated beef and crisp braised greens, with a light sauce that does not drown out the various components.  As for drinks, not much of a wine list, so stick to something simple like a glass of sauvignon blanc, or just order a Singha beer or hot tea.

* Query: what's with diners in asian restaurants ordering individual "entrees" and not sharing?  come on, when in Rome... oops, wrong continent but you get the picture...
author: Yan L.

description: Good food especially if you want something fast and convenient. A great place after you've had a few drinks in the neighborhood. The spicy eggplant with chicken is delish. Very reasonable prices. Great service!
author: Vincent L.

description: I've always ordered to-go, so I can't really comment on their wait staff.  However, when I did place my orders, they were always so nice and never messed anything up.  I usually ordered their Pad Thai, which hit the spot...but sometimes it was on point, sometimes it wasn't. Just like someone said earlier, their Pad Thai would be a little oilier than normal...and I like my pan thai on the drier side if that makes any sense.
author: I M.

description:
Last night I ordered food to go and was pretty disappointed.  The corn cakes were greasy and the onions in the cucumber garnish over powered the other flavors.  I also got a yellow curry chicken dish and that was ok but still I've had better.  Finally, for the quality of the food I found it all to be too pricy.  

I can't say that I would recommend this place.
author: David C.

description: Best pad see-ew delivery - moist, full of good green veggies, and succulent tofu.  yum. my favorite of the mediocre thai restaurant delivery scene.
author: pav V.

description: Excellent Thai Food, fresh and outstanding service, shrimp fried rice and green curry with pork was awesome. Nice atmosphere and lots of smiles (from the Land of Smiles)
author: Mark P.

description: This place has two things going for it...  It is right next to my yoga, and there was plenty of seating.  Otherwise, the food is a dollar or more than what you would pay at other Thai restaraunts, and decidedly dull.  I give it an, "eeehh".
author: Amme P.

description: Way too greasy. You could go there for drinks, I suppose, but then, there are so many other lovely places in the Castro to drink. Try Thai House Express at 19th and Castro - cheaper and muuuch yummier.
author: Anika K.

description: What a yummy place with a great decor and atmosphere. My boyfriend and I stopped by for a Thai ice-tea to go and picked up a menu. I saw so many good dishes on the menu that we decided to go back for dinner. The service was great and the prices are reasonable. We had shrimp & chicken tom yum soup, beef pad see eiw and the seafood claypot. Everything was presented nicely and delicious. The only complain I have is the pad see eiw - it wasn't as tasty as others that I've had. There wasn't enough sauce in it or something and it was a bit bland. The claypot had prawns, scallops, mussels, fish and zucchini and the curry sauce was really yummy! The portions are generous too. We're definitely coming back to try other things!
author: Gladys C.

description: I ordered a vegetarian soup and it was very salty. The other dishes my friends ordered looked appetizing, but then again, there's the excellent Thailand Restaurant around the corner.
author: John C.

description: I like this place.  Unpretentious, tasty food, reasonable prices, no wait.  They do Tom Ka Gai very well, too.
author: Ken B.

description: had dinner here last night and it was pretty fair.  Started with chicken satay and it was a very small portion for 2 people.  Runny peanut sauce kind of made me weary.  Had the red chicken curry as the entree and again, just pretty fair.  I have eaten at so many thai places that my expectations are pretty high so sorry to say I was not really impressed here.  It seemed clean and service was nice.
author: Denny R.

description: mango with sweet and sticky rice....i'm still dreaming about it.  will have to come back to review the entrees
author: Ben T.

description: Their lunch specials are great. You get soup, salad, rice, veggies and 2 mini entrees for like $8.95. not bad.
author: M M.

description: We love the Thai Chef especially when we have a large group of people!  They never hassle us about how long we take (of course we do keep our eyes open as to the amount of people in the restaurant).  They have gone through changes with their chefs but the current one is just as good as the one who originally kept us going back.  Portions are okay, not huge, since they concentrate on quality.  That gives us a chance to try a couple a dishes!
author: Keefe C.

description: I didn't know there was an original Thai Chef.  In any event, this place is on the upswing.  I thought the service was outstanding -- they brought my gf & I an extra beer because they felt like the beer we had wasn't cold enough.  the wonton was killer.  the entrees were tasty as well.  i don't understand the negative reviews of this place -- oh well, it was packed, so maybe the word on the street is positive.
author: Tim G.

description: The order of fried wontons was REALLY small for the price, like bite sized little fried ball thingies, they forgot our entree, the coconut soup was overwhelmingly lemony, but we got our entree comped because they forgot it, and they did that without my having to ask, so that's why they get 2 stars.  I won't go back.  Now to try Thai house express........
author: Jonathan M.

description: This is a great place to grab some decent Thai food.  The food is good.  It's not the best, but I do love their Cashew Chicken and the Pad Thai w/ crab (don't know the name).  It's really good.  You can also just hop in there after going to the bars.  Very convenient.
author: Eric S.

description:
Finally ate their after passing this place a bunch of times. After looking at the menu and seeing what I wanted to eat was under $10 dollars I was set.      When I got my food it was hot and fresh, Way better than what Thai food I usually eat (King Of Thai off of Clement and 8th approx.). I'm defiantly going back their again sometime this week as its a great place when you don't want to spend a lot of money. If you can't make up your mind and your in the Castro try this place. I had the Green Curry Chicken and it was done real well as it wasn't too spicy, didn't skimp on the chicken, good amount of rice, oh yeah and the service was pretty good but then again I ate at a time when their was only a few people. 
all and all 4 stars because I've only been their once...If anyone has had a good dish their, contact me and let me know what to try or if anyone knows of a good Thai Place in San Francisco hit me up as I just moved here.
author: Ben L.

description: Thai is one of my favorite foods and I've eaten at many great Thai restaurants here in the city. So far Thai Chef has been the most consistent when it comes to good food and excellent service - on the go. When I call for delivery they are always so nice. The biggest problem I've had with other Thai restaurants is that although I love me some spicy food, many times I can't handle the level of heat you get at most restaurants (even when I ask for mild). I've never had a problem with food being overly spicy here and the flavor is always spot on. Keep up the good work guys!!!
author: Stephanie R.

description: Great Apetizers!  I loooove their redcurry with prawns.  Fantastic place to go to.
author: J Angel G.

description:
Dined here several times but never again. I ordered the 'fried spring rolls' to start and since the waiter was having a little bit of a tough time with English I made it clear and thought it best to show him by pointing to the menu and also telling him the item number which he repeated. So, guess what? Yep, food comes and it's wrong. It's the uncooked fresh rolls. I advised him as soon as I looked down and saw it in front of me that "oh sorry, this is not correct".  Only to be told "yes, this what you order". I tried to explain to him that I had even pointed to the menu and showed him the item number, however he was adamant that he was right and walked away. I gave the appetizers to my partner as I really only like the rolls cooked - just my taste I guess.   The main course came and fortunately that was correct.  Now I thought maybe some kind of apology would be in order here, perhaps I thought he may go back and check his notes or check with the kitchen, but no.  Was there a sign on the wall that stated 'the customer is always wrong"?

Every time I walk past this place they always seem to be in dire need of customers and often wonder how much longer the place will survive. I paid the bill, got up, walked out and swore never to go back. Thai restaurants are a dime a dozen here in S.F. - I simply don't need one with attitude thank you very much.
author: Bobby J.

description: I really like their garlic eggplant and spicy fish!  Also, I love that they deliver up until 10PM and their portions are huge.  The people who own the place are really nice too.
author: Christie F.

description: this is my new favorite Thai place! The tofu satay is amazing as well as the pineapple fried rice and red curry duck..hell I have not had anything bad there!! hip hip hooray and they are kid friendly in he day time for sure
author: Kitty L.

description: Best Thai food for your dollar in SF hands down. I have tried a majority of the dishes and have yet to not like any of them. Coconut shrimp curry is great and is also served in a coconut. Cashew chicken nut is amazing and the sauteed eggplant is my second favorite. However being a fan of curry I have to say that the duck curry is spectacular and is easily my number one.
author: J D.

description:
It's a nice looking restaurant, however the service and food has gone down severly in the past year.  I've been trying to just blame it on the day, but it's consistently gotten worse.  The dishes here are extremely salty and greasy.  It's not a good sign when you have to order rice to add it all to your crispy beef noodles to make it bearable.  

No more chances.  I'm not going back there again.  You can get much better Thai food at Thailand Restaurant on Castro between 17th and 18th Street.
author: Ellie K.

description: came here last night on pink saturday! wanted a place to eat that wasn't packed. it was my first time here, so i got my regular order of pad see ew bc you can't go wrong with that! it was ok. my friend got the green curry fried rice and it was sooo good! i tried getting the same dish at another thai restaurant but it was not the same! i'd come back here to get it
author: Priscilla W.

description: I ordered a rice-noodle dish with vegetables only (no chicken or seafood).  A few minutes later, one of the waiters brought me a complimentary cup of soup that had vegetables floating in it.  I asked another waiter nearby whether the broth was vegetarian.  He checked with the kitchen and told me it was a chicken broth.  When I paid my bill, I went to the front counter and asked the person who seemed to be in charge whether I could offer some feedback, and he said yes.  I told him, in a friendly tone of voice, that I felt it would be better service in the future if they tell customers who order vegetarian dishes that the soup they serve to everyone is not vegetarian.  The person I spoke to got very defensive told me the responsibility lies on me to ask whether the soup is vegetarian.  I didn't argue with him, but this felt like extremely poor customer service.  If you're going to eat at this restaurant, don't count on them to look after your dietary needs or to be courteous when you point out a problem.  And, by the way, they overcharged me for my entrée, and even after I pointed out the error and they re-did the bill, it still had the same overcharge.  I would not recommend eating at this restaurant.
author: Dave S.

description: Excellent service and food. I enjoyed the lighting, and the low noise level of this place and will go there again.
author: Matt W.

description: I have yet to find really good Thai food in the bay area. This place is ok, they are priced decently but the food isn't that great. The one great thing on the menu is the tofu satay. The pad thai and the pineapple fried rice are meh.
author: V R.

description: My carry-out order on 7/13/07 was full of long stringy white things that were either hair or plastic (either way, disgusting).  Definitely not edible.  I took it back and showed the manager - they didn't know what it was either, and gave me my $ back.
author: ROGER C.

description: There is nothing special about this restaurant at all.  The service was fine and the prices are reasonable but basically its just very bland Thai food. The food has no flavor at all. I find  can't find any reason why I would wanna go back again.
author: eric b.

description: Really nice for dinner.  Food was great.  Service was very attentive and unobtrusive.  Noise level allows easy conversation.  Lovely decor.  Good prices.  It has the Health Departments "Symbol of Excellence" too.  My second time there.
author: J C.

description:
very nice food - we like it! the tom yam soup and the red curry are really great.

the reason why only 4 out of 5 stars: well, try to order by telefone ... "can you spell it please" is what you'll hear maaaaaany times :-)
author: joerg l.

description: i have to say i have eaten here 4 times and the food has been good.  notibly the volcano beef and curry salmon. they just changed their name, can't remember what it is and they started advertising for free delivery. they are about 15 min to downtown so i stopped by to order and since was running late, asked them to delivery and even added in the tip.  however, be warned, do not have them delivery to business because they do not know how to. by the time i got back to the office, the delivery guy was there and called me, i offered to go downstairs to pick up so they don't have to come up, however, he was not there. i work in a large office building. i walked around the building and even went outside for at least 10 mins. no delivery. came back upstairs, called the guy and he was more aggetiated then me. telling me he can't wait anymore because he can't park any longer, he will get a ticket. are you kidding me. it takes 15 min to walk over fromt eh restaurant, why did you drive and if you are delivering, you can't expect to be in and out in 5 mins. i told him to go back and cancel my order since the reason i ordered delivery was because i had to be in meetings all day and can't go out. so i had to say food is 4 star so far, but delivery is no star.
author: Silver C.
